items.title: Network Upgrades
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Today I spent almost the entire day upgrading my network cable in the attic and setting up for bringing a backup internet connection online. While upgrading the network, I thought I had Cat5e Cable in the attic. It turned out to be Cat 5 and my Dad and myself installed it in 1995 almost 30 years ago. So now I have Cat 6 and I ran two lines with my dad's help and then made my own keystone Cat 6 jacks for the first time. A lot of people might ask why Cat 6, not 6A, or 7, or even 8. Well, I chose Cat 6 because it should be fine for my needs and I watched several videos that Cat 7 or 8 are not official specs.

There were a few hiccups on the way but it is done. Now I just have to set up my TP-Link Omada Router and turn my Wifi5 Netgear Orbi and Satellite into Access Points.

I will eventually upgrade the Access Points but I am taking this one thing at a time. I already have a backup internet connection. Frontier Fiber 500/500 is my main internet connection. Spectrum stopped by my house a few weeks ago and offered me a deal I could not refuse. 300/10 for 19.99 for 2 years. So I figured since I am working from home 3 times a week and while Frontier Fiber has been reliable it has gone down a few times in the almost 2 years I have had it. So for that amount, it was worth having as an insurance policy.

Finally, things are lining up and I have been learning a lot lately. WordPress, how to make keystone jacks. Hopefully more exciting things and news coming.

items.title: Easter: Celebrating the Resurrection of Jesus Christ
items.content_html:
Easter is a time of great celebration for Christians all over the world. It marks the resurrection of Jesus Christ, the son of God, after he was crucified on the cross for the sins of humanity. This event is the cornerstone of the Christian faith and is seen as a symbol of hope, love, and redemption.

The Bible teaches that Jesus was crucified on the cross, buried, and then rose again three days later. This event is recorded in the New Testament in the books of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. In Matthew 28:6, it says, “He is not here, for he has risen, as he said. Come, see the place where he lay.” The resurrection of Jesus was a physical, tangible event, and his disciples saw him alive after his death on the cross. This event is the foundation of the Christian faith and is seen as proof that Jesus was who he claimed to be — the Son of God.

The resurrection of Jesus has far-reaching implications for believers today. First, it provides hope and assurance that death is not the end. Through his resurrection, Jesus defeated death and offers eternal life to all who believe in him. In John 11:25-26, Jesus says, “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, and everyone who lives and believes in me shall never die.” This verse provides hope and assurance that death is not the end and that believers will have eternal life with God.

God loved humanity so much that he sent his only son, Jesus, to die for our sins. Through his death and resurrection, Jesus took the punishment for our sins and made a way for us to be reconciled to God. In Romans 5:8, it says, “But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.” This verse reminds us that God’s love is unconditional and that he loves us despite our flaws and mistakes.

Finally, the resurrection of Jesus provides a foundation for our faith. Through his death and resurrection, Jesus shows us that God has a plan and purpose for our lives. He offers us the hope and assurance that, no matter what we face in this life, we can trust in God’s sovereignty and love. In Colossians 2:13-15, it says, “And you, who were dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses, by canceling the record of debt that stood against us with its legal demands. This he set aside, nailing it to the cross. He disarmed the rulers and authorities and put them to open shame, by triumphing over them in him.” This verse reminds us that, through Jesus' death and resurrection, we have been forgiven and made alive in Christ.

Easter is a time of great celebration and a reminder of the significance of Jesus' death and resurrection. It provides hope, love, and a foundation for our faith. As we celebrate this holiday, let us remember the sacrifice of Jesus on the cross and the hope and assurance that his resurrection brings. Let us embrace his love and make him the cornerstone of our lives. #Easter #Resurrection #SacrificeOfJesus #Christian #Hope #Love #FoundationForFaith

Sources and Bible Verses:

  • Matthew 28:6: “He is not here, for he has risen, as he said. Come, see the place where he lay.”
  • John 11:25-26: “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, and everyone who lives and believes in me shall never die.”
  • Romans 5:8: “But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.”
  • Colossians 2:13-15: “And you, who were dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses, by canceling the record of debt that stood against us with its legal demands. This he set aside, nailing it to the cross. He disarmed the rulers and authorities and put them to open shame, by triumphing over them in him.”

The Holy Bible (English Standard Version)

Let us embrace his love and make him the cornerstone of our lives. #Easter #Resurrection #SacrificeOfJesus #Christian #Hope #Love #FoundationForFaith --- ### Sources and Bible Verses: - **Matthew 28:6**: "He is not here, for he has risen, as he said. Come, see the place where he lay." - **John 11:25-26**: "I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, and everyone who lives and believes in me shall never die." - **Romans 5:8**: "But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us." - **Colossians 2:13-15**: "And you, who were dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses, by canceling the record of debt that stood against us with its legal demands. This he set aside, nailing it to the cross. He disarmed the rulers and authorities and put them to open shame, by triumphing over them in him." The Holy Bible (English Standard Version)

items.title: ChatGPT
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I asked ChatGPT to compose a poem comparing the lives of Jesus Christ and Alexander the Great. This is what it wrote:

Jesus and Alexander, two great names, Whose lives and legacies forever remain. One a king of men, the other King of Kings, Both with armies and power at their wings.

Alexander conquered lands far and wide, His empire stretching from side to side. But Jesus, a different kind of king, His kingdom not of this world, but within.

Alexander, a hero of war and might, His conquests, a source of great delight. But Jesus, a hero of love and grace, His sacrifice, the human race to embrace.

Alexander's legacy is one of fame, His conquests, a source of great acclaim. But Jesus' legacy is one of love, A gift to us from the heavens above.

In death, Alexander's empire fell, But Jesus' message, forever will dwell. For while Alexander's reign was temporal, Jesus' reign eternal, forever immortal.

 

This is quite Similar to Charles Ross Weede poem The Conquerors. Both are quite good and ChatGPT is quite interesting to use.  I spent about 1 hour with it tonight.

items.title: Mitchelltribe.social Mastondon Server
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Hello everyone, 

I just wanted to let you know besides Twitter I am on Mastodon in two places. I am on Mastodon Pixelfed that is supposed to be an Instagram replacement. I haven't started to use that yet as I am still trying to figure that out. My main account is on mitchelltribe.social. I watched a YouTube video on how to create your own server. 

I made my own server as the main mastodon.social was not accepting any new accounts. Pixelfed doesn't do text yet so I decided to make my own so it aligns with the family website. It is not open to everyone. It is mainly for my family if they should chose to get on Mastodon and I may open it up to a few friends or extended family if any show interest. 

I have to keep it small because I am paying for it but at least I own it. So with that in mind I am at 

@michael@mitchelltribe.social

@mlm361@pixelfed.social (Instagram replacement)

@mlm361 on Twitter

Of course my website is is at [www.mitchelltribe.com](https://www.mitchelltribe.com) (but it only has a landing page).

items.title: Merry Christmas 2022
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I want to wish everyone a Merry Christmas. Remember this is the season we celebrate the birth of Lord Jesus. 

I hope everyone has a great Christmas and has a great time.

items.title: Christmas and the end of the year fast approaching
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Christmas 2023 is fast approaching and so is the end of 2022. 2022 has been a mixed bag for me. This year for some reason has just felt weird. I am not sure why and really can't put my finger on it. Some of the year felt like it was moving a glacier speed and some felt like it was moving at warp speed. 

I am still debating whether to send out Christmas Cards. I need to decide very soon. I have received a few this year. I am leaning to skipping this year and see how next year goes and may resume next year. I will definitely have to decide this week. 

In any event I hope everyone has a Merry Christmas and remember the reason for the Season, JESUS!

items.title: Happy Thanksgiving 2022
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Happy Thanksgiving 2022 everyone. I hope everyone has a great Thanksgiving on Thursday and gets like the bird stuffed. I am looking forward to the next few days as I relax and have some time away from work. 

Speaking of taking time from work. I am using it to get caught up on car maintenance. I spent 319 dollars today getting an oil change and rear brakes. I also got a recalled fixed. I was expecting them to tell me my tires need replacing. I received some good news and was told my tires are only 50% worn so I am good to go for a little more. The dealer I go to has treated me great so I stick with them. However, I may not be able to with the tires. They were asking way more than I can get them at Costco. So sometime in the first few months of 2023 I will probably get them from Costco. 

Take care everyone and have a great Thanksgiving week.

items.title: Post Hurricane Ian
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Hurricane Ian has come and gone. Being born and raised in Florida this is the worst Hurricane I have experienced and we did not take a direct hit. We lost power for almost 48 hours. This hurricane had the highest winds I have ever experienced and the rain when it fell was immense and intense as the bands rotated around. 

I can only imagine what Fort Myers went through. I lived there for a couple of years and can't believe what they endured. Thank you Lord for turning this thing before it got here. If it did it might be years before things would have return to semi-normal.

items.title: Hurricane Ian is upon us
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Hurricane Ian is upon us. It is a dreary day today with occasional bursts of wind. Work told us we would be closed for the next 2 days. So I had to use my own Paid Time Off but that is ok I have plenty. I expect the weather will get worse later on today once the storm finally either goes north or makes landfall south of us. Luckily, we will not take a direct hit but will still get the effects except the storm surge. We still have power and internet for now. Hope all will come out ok with this storm. 

This is the latest:

items.title: First Hurricane Threat of the season
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well it seems that we have our first hurricane threat of the season. Hopefully we will dodge a bullet but we will have to wait and see. 

As far as me, I got my Covid-19 Bivalent booster shot and thought it would explode my heart. I went into A-Fib the first time that has happened in several years. I think I will be skipping any further Covid-19 shots.

I also wanted to say my TV habits have changed with the different streaming services and I think it has gotten better.

items.title: The State of Things at Large
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I have been wanting to type this post for a while. I am just frustrated with how things are right now as in society at large. Inflation and what will likely be a recession next year and where have all the people gone. I know we lost about a million people that died directly or indirectly from the Pandemic but were is everyone else. Eating out right now is not a great option whether it is a fast food place or a causal dining experience. I know a lot of people left those jobs either voluntarily or involuntarily (because of shut downs and such) and went elsewhere. But the elsewheres are also having problems getting people. It just feels like people evaporated. Yet traffic has increased. Everywhere you look it looks like business are needing people but you also feel this uneasy feeling that huge layoffs are coming. I am not sure what is going on. 

But to the employees in fast food. I know some of you probably hate the job because it is all you could get or you just don't care. Remember food is something we all like to eat and just imagine if you gave your family some of the food you all are pushing off on people and then people get irate. I know fast food is supposed to be fast and not a 5 star meal but it should be decent where when you bite into you go what in the world is the garbage.

items.title: Happy 2022
items.content_html: Happy New Year and let’s hope 2022 is better. 2021 was a terrible year for me compared to 2020 believe it or not. Even though 2020 was the start of Pandemic it was a better year for me personally. As far as New Year’s resolutions I don’t do that but would like to read more this year. Well that is it for now. Hope everyone stays safe.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Merry Christmas Eve to everyone!

I hope everyone has a great day and remember the real celebration is tomorrow. It is a birthday celebration of OUR LORD and Savior Jesus. Without him everlasting life would be impossible. 

May everyone have a great, Merry and Blessed Christmas tomorrow.

items.title: My new computer
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, it finally happened. I had to get a new computer. My old computer an Alienware Aurora R5 was on it's last leg. It had several problems and I was really worried it was going to give out. Now, I wanted a new computer with an AMD Ryzen 9 5900X with a NVIDIA RTX 3080 with all the trimmings. But with the supply issues and the outrageous cost with everything blown out of proportion I decided to get a low end but respectable computer. I ended up with a Levono Legion AMD desktop. It has a Ryzen 7 5700G and an NVIDIA RTX 3060. It is all propriety and I wanted to stay away from it, but the case can actually hold off the shelf components and most all the reviews were positive. So I bit the bullet and had Bestbuy send me one, even though I believe this computer would be about 500 dollars cheaper if this was a couple of years ago. I have to say so far I am impressed and hope it gets me through the next 3 years if not more as I think as I believe it will take that long for prices to come back to normal and supply to return to normal or better.

items.title: Shortages Shortages and more shortages
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
This is the first time in my 52 years alive that I can remember everything and anything you want being on shortage. I am not just talking the latest tech, but yea I haven't been able to buy a new computer as there are shortages of components and the prices are way out of whack. I am talking food shortages and what not. I see on forums people all over the Country saying no shortages here and there. But, I can tell you where I live I see it and the shelves are bare and what you do find you buy it and it turns out that it might be bad. For example a dozen eggs where bought and we cooked half of the dozen for 3 people and we all bit into the eggs and they were off tasting and bad. By the way on that batch it say large eggs and they were almost as small as Whoopers (not kidding should have taken a picture, I joke the USDA inspector must have been off that day). The next batch bought at a different store looked like large eggs and tasted fine. 

I have been in Publix quite a few times and seen either completely empty shelves or sparsely populated shelves. I hope this doesn't continued but I fear it is here for other year with or without the pandemic continuing. Which quite frankly I think most people don't care anymore and are acting like it doesn't and I feel that other people feel it is over. While I will say I am fully vaccinated so I am just not worrying about dying. I don't want to catch it but I can't control other people.

items.title: Pixel 6 Pro prelimiary review
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I got the Google Pixel 6 Pro pre-launch as they were giving away free Pixel Buds and with everything in short supply now days I went ahead and got it. It arrived yesterday. So far, my biggest thing is that I wish Google would figure out a way I can say hi you know how I have the present phone set up on the home screens do the same thing. 

I also have the power button screen glitch when the phone is off . Since it doesn't seem to effect my phone otherwise I will wait and see what Google discovers about it or if it causes any problems. I do say the one biggest hardware flaw I see with the phone is the in display fingerprint sensor. It is awful performance. I wished Google would have stuck with the rear fingerprint sensor it was awesome had some hidden features like pulling down the notification area and was just in the right place for your finger.

Haven't tried the the camera's yet so can't say about the quality and will update soon as I do. The screen is gorgeous and the performance seems fluid to me. The build seems balance and very top notch as far as shape and quality of the actual phone.

Well there are my first raw impressions. Will keep everyone updated on the phone as time goes on. Back to personalizing the phone. Please Google improve that experience. Takes too long to setup a new phone. It is like moving everyone hates packing and unpacking.

items.title: Pixel 6 Pro
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

Thanks Blogger and Google for 20 years.

items.title: 4th of July 2021
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

Happy 4th of July 2021 to everyone. Hope everyone has a safe and Happy 4th of July. This year we are seeing the World rebound from hopefully once in a lifetime Pandemic. During this time my normal TV viewing habits have changed and I find myself watching less newer TV shows and series and more old favorites and finding new stuff to watch on YouTube.   

The stuff on YouTube has been very interesting and pretty good. I have found some new music I like and new performers. Well anyways just wanted to right a quick blog and tell everyone Happy 4th of July.

items.title: What if?
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
What if you won the lottery? I always think this. I imagine depending on how much I won where I would live. Hawaii, French Polynesia, Corfu, or Crete. That is my shortlist. Each has its pros and cons. I lean toward Hawaii as it is part of the United States does not require a passport and the people speak English.

Well, that was just a what-if and a random thought. I hope everyone has a good Memorial Day.

items.title: Just thinking
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

I was just thinking I haven't posted in a long time. Nothing really worth posting. Other than I have gotten my Covid-19 vaccine, both does of the Pfizer. 

I have also been thinking lately about how I have been watching more oldie TV. I find the shows comforting and better than some of the junk they are trying to show on regular shows with all the PC junk going on right now. 

Tonight is the last night of a little stay at home vacation I took. Back to the grind tomorrow. 

Take care everyone for now.

Happy New Year! My first post of this year. It is after midnight and I am still up because we have fireworks going off all around us. I guess the neighbors shooting off fireworks thanks it good to keep going into the wee morning hours. Well, hopefully this will be it. 


Lets hope this is a great year.

items.title: Last Post of 2020
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

Wishing everyone a Happy New Year. Let's pray the Lord will Bless us all in 2021. 

My Mom and I were talking today. For our Family, other than my father losing his job this year, 2020 was not that bad of a year for our Family. We all had relatively good health and did not get COVID-19. So this year has not been bad as the Lord kept us safe and blessed. We are hoping that our financial fortunes turn positive but other than that we are good. 

Hope you all have a safe night and will hopefully blog more in 2021.

items.title: Merry Christmas Eve!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Merry Christmas Eve to everyone!

Hope everyone is doing great. My family is doing as good as can be expected in light of everything. We are all COVID free which is great. Just wanted to remind everyone to keep in mind The Reason for the Season the birth of Our King Jesus. So while you celebrate and get and give gifts remember the true reason why we celebrate.

items.title: Season Finale's
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I have to say Disney+ is a hit and the Series The Mandalorian is great. I just watched the Season 2 Finale and it was 9 out of 10. Jon Favreau and Dave Filoni should have been handed the keys to the Star Wars Universe. They have the best handle on the Star Wars Canon and tying all the Star Wars Universe Materials together. Abrams did a disservice to the Star Wars Universe. I can't wait to see how the keep Season 3 going with Grogu (aka Baby Yoda) now supposedly off. Hopefully The Manalorian keeps going for a few more seasons and we see an older Grogu that can catch back up with Mando and the gang and due stuff.Again, that was a great Season Finale. Thanks to all who work on this series it is a need break in my week to watch this Series, my only complaint what happened to a series being 20-23 episodes a year 😀?

Star Trek Discovery also had their Season Finale. It wasn't as great but there was some interesting tidbits in there to the past. I just wish they would either pick a strategy or if they are going to mix it up with the action and exploration it would be a little more woven together. I understand why they had to do the last 2 episodes but I think they could have done them earlier and it would have fit in better and again a Series like Star Trek should be longer than 10 episodes a Season. 

Finally I understand this year why there will be more time between Seasons but honestly before this year there is no excuse. TV Seasons used to be three to four months. Now we are going up to a year (before the pandemic hit) or longer. Come on TV people get it together.

items.title: Coronavirus Family Update Status
items.content_html: My family and I have been doing fine. We have not been sick other than I have a minor sinus infection. But again none of us have been tested so we don’t know if we are carriers. We try to keep away from everyone and only go out for work or the grocery store. I wish there was reliable testing everywhere. I blame China for this and wish we would pull everything out of there. Not really sure where to move it, prefer for it to come back here, but that is not happening unless the Government forces it to do so. I hope everyone else is doing great. Take care and will be off after tomorrow for a forced week off for cost-saving measures.

items.title: End of an era
items.content_html: It is the end of an Era for the Mitchell Tribe as I have sold the Inverness Property I inherited from my Grandmother. I tried to hold onto it until I could fix it and improve the land with a new trailer but after 12 years and money lost I sold it. I remember spending my summers up there with my Grandmother and my family going up there and watching the fireflies and walking up there and being able to just relax. In the last few months, I have not been relaxing but have been stressing about the property as the “new” neighbors were squatting and illegally storing stuff in a run-down trailer. So rather than put up with the next door hooligans I sold the property at a significant loss. I believe that the group I sold it too will improve. So The Mitchell’s bid Citrus County a farewell.

items.title: Wuhan China Virus (COVID19)
items.content_html: Well, I hope everyone is doing great and keeping their social distance and washing their hands. The Wuhan China Virus is teaching us a lot as a Nation and People. Here is what I am learning so far.1. Our Internet Infrastructure is not adequate if a majority of people are working from home. Congress in their Coronavirus 4 package needs to include money to finally bring fiber to every corner of the US and I mean wired either through their own through municipalities and through grants to private companies. 2. Hospitals need some kind of Federalization during an incident like this. 3. Unemployment needs to be rethought and pandemic provisions.4. The U.S. needs to sue China for this as this is the Communist Government fault. Either it was a bioweapon that went wrong or they need strict sanitary laws for those wet markets if it was truly crossed that way. This is the third respiratory virus that has originated from China (SARS, MERS and now Covid19). China at a minimum needs to forgive our national debt total to them.   Those are my opinions and thoughts right now. Remember to wash your hands frequently and keep your distance. Be safe and COVID19 free.
items.content_text:
Well, I hope everyone is doing great and keeping their social distance and washing their hands. The Wuhan China Virus is teaching us a lot as a Nation and People. Here is what I am learning so far.

1. Our Internet Infrastructure is not adequate if a majority of people are working from home. Congress in their Coronavirus 4 package needs to include money to finally bring fiber to every corner of the US and I mean wired either through their own through municipalities and through grants to private companies. 

2. Hospitals need some kind of Federalization during an incident like this. 

3. Unemployment needs to be rethought and pandemic provisions.

4. The U.S. needs to sue China for this as this is the Communist Government fault. Either it was a bioweapon that went wrong or they need strict sanitary laws for those wet markets if it was truly crossed that way. This is the third respiratory virus that has originated from China (SARS, MERS and now Covid19). China at a minimum needs to forgive our national debt total to them.   

Those are my opinions and thoughts right now. Remember to wash your hands frequently and keep your distance. Be safe and COVID19 free.

items.title: Broadband in America
items.content_html: I have been thinking lately about a lot of things broadband related. If telecom and cable companies don’t start investing in building out high-speed internet they are going to lose. When Starlink and OneWeb and even if Kuiper gets up and running they are going to lose a good portion of there customer base depending if these low orbit satellites residential price is right. Centurylink and Frontier will definitely be bankrupt and probably under Government control. For instance, I inherited a piece of property in rural part of the Country. The fastest internet I could get there is only 15/1 ADSL2+.  However, it might be more viable to me with gigabit internet with low latency. Just my two cents.

Centurylink and Frontier will definitely be bankrupt and probably under Government control.

items.title: Welcome 2020
items.content_html: Welcome 2020 be kind to us and thank you Lord Almighty for another year in your presence.
items.content_text: Welcome 2020 be kind to us and thank you Lord Almighty for another year in your presence.

items.title: Good Bye 2019
items.content_html: This will be my last entry for 2019, my 50th year on this Earth. This year has been a much better year than the last few in many ways and worse in some ways. Overall, I will say I did not mind this year. Not sure how 2020 will turn out for me, but I am hoping it will build on the positive things from this last year. My 50th year overall was positive and hoping 2020 will continue. I am praying that if Jesus does not come back that my family and myself have a great and blessed year (2020) along with every one of my friends. See you in the New Year. 2020 here I come!

My 50th year overall was positive and hoping 2020 will continue.

See you in the New Year. 2020 here I come!

items.title: Google Please!!!!
items.content_html: Google the Pixel 4 disappoints. Please listen for the survival of the Pixel line. No, I don’t have the Pixel 4 nor do I want one. Why?
items.content_text:
Google the Pixel 4 disappoints. Please listen for the survival of the Pixel line. No, I don't have the Pixel 4 nor do I want one. Why?

  1.  No fingerprint reader. Face unlock/ID might be just as secure, but it is not 100 percent reliable. 
  2. No FM chip. I know that streaming is your bread and butter but it would bring in more people to the Pixel ecosystem and it does have National Security/Emergency implications.
  3. No Headphone-jack. Think of it you would trump Apple and shame Apple at the same time. 
  4. Minimum 128GB and 256GB for memory instead of 64GB and 128GB. 
  5. Bringing back the 2 front cameras and keeping the soli chip. 
  6. Improve video recording quality to beat Apple like the superior still shots.
  7. This is a big one lower the price by 200 to 250. I believe you will still make a profit. 
  8. Optional adding to 2TB SD card support, but I could live without this one. 
  9. Bring it out in July instead of October. Beating Apple by 2 months and being able to use the latest Qualcomm chip before it becomes obsolete in October.  
What do you think?

items.title: Retirement
items.content_html: My permanent retirement is still a little ways off. Just wondering where I should retire. I have pluses and minuses for each one. Thinking of the list below. Does anyone have any thoughts and suggestions? My retirement will be mostly Social Security and will need my money to last, high-speed internet and good medical facilities (which includes doctors).
items.content_text:
My permanent retirement is still a little ways off. Just wondering where I should retire. I have pluses and minuses for each one. Thinking of the list below. Does anyone have any thoughts and suggestions? My retirement will be mostly Social Security and will need my money to last, high-speed internet and good medical facilities (which includes doctors).

  1. Paris, Tennessee
  2. Logan, WV
  3. Lewisburg, WV
  4. Chattanooga, TN
  5. Inverness, FL
  6. The home city where I am now.
  7. St Ives UK
  8. Corfu, Greece 

The last two are foreign yes I know, but I have done a lot of research on them and like them for their visual appeal. Corfu Greece is probably the most affordable of the two foreign choices.

items.title: Microsoft's Surface Event
items.content_html: The highlight of this week was watching the Microsoft Surface Event. I liked and wanting everything they announced. My wallet says no and that is the final word. My head says get get get! I plan on waiting to see the reviews and hope that next year will be a better year financially so that I can maybe get one of the new devices. I am really looking forward to the Surface Neo. Google’s event I am kind of not looking forward too. I like the camera advancements I have been hearing about. Google why can’t you leave the fingerprint reader, add a headphone jack and an FM tuner that would make it a big BUY for me. I know Google is planning to announce other things, but I have several Google devices and like every one of them. I wish the would simplify the privacy options by having one setting choice so that I could saw delete all my maps, history and other information collected after 18 months. Instead, you have to set each feature separately.

I get home and look in the bottle and I have only 6 pills. So I called CVS they will have the other one ready for me. I am not making an extra trip until Monday after work. Everywhere I go nowadays something is always messed up because places are short staff or just pressured to perform. We all need to slow down just a touch. The only thing that should be lightning fast is our internet.

items.title: 18 Years Ago
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Do you remember where you were when 9/11 attacks occurred? I do. I was in traffic court in Plant City, Florida.I had just left when my mother called me to tell me about the first plane and then while I was on the phone with her she watched the second plane fly into the Tower. That whole day was a long day for me and I remember almost everything about that day. 

Hopefully, nothing like it will happen again. Be safe and be careful every day.

items.title: Cloud Computing
items.content_html: have been thinking a lot lately about how everything is or wants to go to the cloud. I think the only thing that should be in the cloud for sure is back up. Otherwise, I prefer to have everything locally. I know that companies are pushing us to the cloud/remote storage for subscription fees and never-ending revenue for them. The internet situation in this Country is not very good. I am lucky to live in an area that has broadband (although both the companies that can service us are not the greatest). I could also settle with music in the cloud and streaming it (as this is not bandwidth intensive). Watching the Microsoft E3 Xbox Presentation today, I did realize something that might be worth thinking about in the future. With as powerful as the next generation Xbox will be next year on its release and keyboard and mouse support added (not a big controller fan). People can own a cheap to moderately priced PC/Laptop and the next-gen Xbox and come out cheaper than having a full-blown gaming PC. I am seriously considering this in the future. The only thing that would keep me from doing that at this time is I am heavily invested in the Steam store/eco-system and modestly invested in the Epic store and EA Origin platform. Plus all the games I have on disk. If there was a way to bring them over at no charge I will become fully invested this way. I would love just having a nice laptop and the Xbox (with mouse and keyboard) for my gaming system. In the above scenario, I still would like to have local storage. That way I am not dependent on internet access. I would like to get out of the city/suburban area and go to a rural area if fiber was ubiquitous. Well, just me thinking out loud. What do you think?

items.title: Cloud Computing and Cloud Platforms
items.content_html: I watched Google Stadia announcement today. I think this is a great idea but it suffers from one major drawback. Internet connections. A lot of people do not have high-speed internet and it is getting worse. If you do have high-speed internet, some people have data caps (which is ridiculous for a broadband connection or really any connection). The third and final issue is reliability. No matter what your ISP/Broadband connection is going to go down from something at some time. For the first two items, I think Google, Apple, Amazon, Disney, CBS, Netflix, and Microsoft should make a separate entity sort of Hulu like for wired fiber. Wired fiber is the best option in the long run low maintenance cost and will last decades. Or they could split up grants like the various City, County, State, and Federal Government agencies do to expand broadband from electric coops and telephone coops. All I know unless broadband expands to all corners of this Country these services are not going to work. I know that in Paris, Tennessee and Inverness, FL where I have property since they are rural there is no Broadband available. Satellite is not a viable option for gaming. Which brings us to the third item I like having everything local and back up to the cloud. The gaming and movie watching I can live within the cloud but it has to be RELIABLE 99% and there needs to be a way to have a local copy just in case the 1% happens. Just my two cents.

No matter what your ISP/Broadband connection is going to go down from something at some time.

For the first two items, I think Google, Apple, Amazon, Disney, CBS, Netflix, and Microsoft should make a separate entity sort of Hulu like for wired fiber. I know that in Paris, Tennessee and Inverness, FL where I have property since they are rural there is no Broadband available. Satellite is not a viable option for gaming. Which brings us to the third item I like having everything local and back up to the cloud. The gaming and movie watching I can live within the cloud but it has to be RELIABLE 99% and there needs to be a way to have a local copy just in case the 1% happens.

Just my two cents.

items.title: Bella, my cat
items.content_html: Bella, my cat was hit by a car this morning sometime around 5AM to 6AM. She died instantly. I will miss her so much and already miss her. I remember the day she just showed up to our house. She picked me to love like she did. I loved her so much. She had 2 litters of kittens while she was here. I got Katie out of the second litter and she was my favorite like her mother and they both did not want to stay in the house and yard. Both were taken by cars from me. I think I am done having animals. Trooper my very first dog I had to give away because of my first job. Henry my second dog died of old age after having glaucoma and food allergies, but it was old age that got him. Taco my third dog died of seizures that started all of the sudden one day. I got him from my sister who someone rescued from abuse. He loved me and me him just like Henry. Then Katie by a car out on a busy street, now Bella. I don’t think I can take much more heart break. I will miss you Bella you loved me for 5 years and gave me a lot of memories. I hope you know that I loved you so much.

items.title: Hurricane Irma
items.content_html: Hurricane Irma came to visit today, here in Brandon, FL. As I type we are still experiencing it. It is getting worse, but not as bad as predicted. Thank you Lord. If it had been as bad as predicted who knows what may have happen. The State gave us almost no warning time if we wanted to evacuate, work also dragged their feet and kept waiting to know the exact path. Even though it was already known that Hurricane Irma was wider and longer than the entire State of Florida. By the time everyone realized that we were going to get the brunt of the storm all the gas was gone or extremely hard to find. If you did find gas you may not have found anymore by the time you got out of the State, even if you then decided to leave. Then there wasn’t anymore plywood because it was bought up or sent to the east coast. So again thank you again Lord for sparing us the absolute worse as my family chose to stay here. I want to say for the majority of the storm and it still is not quite over, we had power and internet. So thank you TECO and Frontier. I posted a short clip of video of the storm I made for my Mom on my Twitter account. Take care all and now the clean up begins.
items.content_text:
Hurricane Irma came to visit today, here in Brandon, FL. As I type we are still experiencing it. It is getting worse, but not as bad as predicted. Thank you Lord. If it had been as bad as predicted who knows what may have happen. The State gave us almost no warning time if we wanted to evacuate, work also dragged their feet and kept waiting to know the exact path. Even though it was already known that Hurricane Irma was wider and longer than the entire State of Florida. By the time everyone realized that we were going to get the brunt of the storm all the gas was gone or extremely hard to find. If you did find gas you may not have found anymore by the time you got out of the State, even if you then decided to leave. Then there wasn't anymore plywood because it was bought up or sent to the east coast. So again thank you again Lord for sparing us the absolute worse as my family chose to stay here.
I want to say for the majority of the storm and it still is not quite over, we had power and internet. So thank you TECO and Frontier. I posted a short clip of video of the storm I made for my Mom on my Twitter account. Take care all and now the clean up begins.

items.title: My Birthday Yesterday!
items.content_html: I turned 48 yesterday. First, I want to think all of my family and friends for the great birthday wishes. Though no fault of theirs or anyone else it was probably the worst or at least in the top 3 worst of birthday’s. I was sick I have been sick for almost 5 days. I believe it is a virus some kind. Good news I am a little better today. That is why I am blogging today and not yesterday. I keep hoping my life would be getting better the older I get, but the opposite keeps happening. Oh well, I will get over it. My heart has been fast, but in rhythm  so that is good news. Hope no one else in my family gets this bug. It is bad. Hope everyone has a great week.

items.title: Cyroablation for my A-Fib
items.content_html: I had Cyroablation for my A-Fib after having another hospitalization in September of this year. I was at the end of the road for medicine. I had a top rated Cardio surgeon. The actual operation on my heart was a success. My heart is giving me no problem. I did wake up and it felt like it was on fire. However, that quickly went away. The anesthesia I had and tracheal intubation was a different matter. Ever since I woke up I am having a lot of phgleam, extreme sore throat and coughing up bright red blood in the phgleam. I have been intubated before and have never had a sore throat like this. This is constant sore throat. Well, lets hope tomorrow brings relief.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

Well, it has been a weird year so far. My 2004 Dodge Durango gave out (blown head gasket, I think). So, like my brother, sister and sister-in-law, I got a new car (I had too). I got a 2016 Ford Fusion SE and love it. I has so many gadgets on it I am still learning what the car can do.

Work is getting better as far as conditions every year. Just wish the pay would match. I am hoping to go to Tennessee not next year but the year after. I would also like to go to West Virginia within the next 5 years.

Also, I know that I have not updated my website. I have transferred it to a new host. I think a very good one too. However, I am finding I am not very adapt at learning WordPress (at least I haven’t found the right source). If I had the money I would hire someone.

More to come later.

They medicine works it just doesn’t seem to be lasting a full 12 hours. I am going to have to go back to the cardiologist.

I am watching Grease Live! Right now. I think it is ok. Kind of cheesy. Well, hope all my family and friends are doing great.

I have a home phone again. The first time in about 3 years. I bought an Obhai Google Voice box. I got my Mom one too. It works through my internet connection and people don’t even know it is not a regular landline.

Well, I am taking off for now. Remember one month down and 11 more to go before another year ends.

items.title: Just Released from St. Joseph’s Hospital
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Hello All,

I was in the hospital for 3 days this week. I had my first ambulance ride to the hospital. I suffered A-Fib. The first time, I really felt bad where I was worried. They were able to stop the A-Fib and put me on medication. At least it WAS NOT a heart attack or a stoke. Thanks to my coworker, boss and my family for everything. Thanks to Jesus and God for saying it was not time for me to go.

Apparently this is common and serious. My weight had nothing to do with it. My hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) may have contributed to the A-Fib, but it certainly did not help.

I am currently on an antiarrhythmic and a blood thinner. St. Joseph’s staff was great, Tampa Fire Rescue was great and work treated me great. Thanks to all again for everything and let’s hope it is another 46 years before this happens again.


Quote of the Day:
An ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
--Elbert Green Hubbard
Hebrews 10:35-36“So do not throw away your confidence; it will be richly rewarded. You need to persevere so that when you have done the will of God, you will receive what he has promised.”

As far as work, my new position will cause me to come back to work the day after Easter. I generally like to be off on this day, but the timing makes it necessary for me to go in.

As far as work everything is going great. I am still looking for a new software program to update my website. I will probably end up taking a class to learn the new software programs out there. I really miss Microsoft Frontpage. That was the best and easiest program. Sorry to everyone. I haven’t forgot about it just don’t know which program to use that will be simple. If I had the money I think I would pay to have a complete make over on it.

Remember everyone Jesus did for you and me so that we may live forever. That is the meaning of Easter. Don’t forget.

items.title: Easter 2013
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Remember tomorrow when you are taking a moment before eating Easter dinner, that two thousand and thirteen years ago Jesus was born. One thousand, nine hundred and eighty years as of Friday, that Jesus died an extricating death on a wooden splintered filled Cross, paid our account in full from the bonds of sin. What we celebrate tomorrow is remembering all those years ago He Rose and defeated death, Satan and Sin. But was there any doubt of it.


Isaiah 53:3-4“He was despised and rejected by mankind, a man of suffering, and familiar with pain. Like one from whom people hide their faces he was despised, and we held him in low esteem. Surely he took up our pain and bore our suffering, yet we considered him punished by God, stricken by him, and afflicted.”

items.title: What’s been going on!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, I was hoping that this year would be better than next. So far it has been a mixed bag. I was diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM). Then I had a nuclear stress test done. It was discovered that the bottom right of my right is not receiving enough blood or oxygen when under stress. So, I have to undergo a cardiac catheterization to see what the problem is. The doctor told me it wasn’t urgent but I need to have it done. When not stressed my heart is fine. So, I think I will have it done in July 2013 so that I meet my deductible for the new insurance year. I hope everything gets fixed so that I can start exercising a little to lose some weight.

My class this semester is ok. I have a solid “B”.


Quote of the Day:
Work keeps us from three great evils, boredom, vice and need.
--François Marie Arouet Voltaire

items.title: News Update!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
A lot has happened since the start of the year. I haven’t talked about it much, but I am now. I will be cutting my phone and cable service in the next two weeks. I have had to endure several pay cuts in the last few months. Work has had to lay off more than 200 people because of this IMPROVING economy. I fear more cuts are coming and technically I did not get laid off. However, my position on the night shift was eliminated and they were able to transfer on top of another pay cut. Now they have increased our insurance premiums, co-insurance and the amount we paid. I used to think the 80-20 split was bad. We now have a 70-30 split and in some causes 50-50 with a increase of the deductible of course. I thought healthcare was supposed to be recession and depression proof. Well, that is it for now. I continue because I know this world is a temporary stop until we all reach are permanent home. I did find time to update my website. So, stop by and take a look.

Also Happy Independence Day!


Quote of the Day:
No mind is thoroughly well-organized that is deficient in a sense of humor.
--Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Well sorry I haven’t blogged in a while. But, between school and work I have been busy. The semester has ended and I earned a B in my Technical Writing Class and a B- in my IT Concepts course.

Work has been going poorly. My position was cut. However, they were able to keep me and move me from the night shift to the day shift (less money). But, I have a job for now. There are rumors going around they are going to cut 500 people out of 4000 people that work there. So, my position my not be stable yet. I will keep everyone informed. Please keep me in your prayers.

On another front, sorry about not updating the website for a while. Again, the reasons above are my excuse. I will hopefully tackle the website in a couple of weeks. I now have to work on weekends (every third for the time being). I also moved the website to a new host, for cost and speed.

Well that is it for now. Hope everyone is doing fine.

They actually believe that Jesus is the son of God an actual son not God become human. They also believe that Jesus and Satan are brothers. I almost fell on my knees and cried with that statement. Jesus and Satan are not even in the same league. It amazes me how Satan can deceive people. Please pray for her and all the Jehovah Witnesses. This occult needs to not exist.

items.content_text:
What’s been happening lately? Well, a lot. I have been busy at work and college. I am only taking two classes this semester. But, it feels like a second job. I am constantly doing something for my English class and trying to squeeze in my Environmental Science class. I was going to take three classes. But, when I saw the workload for my conversational sociology class I had to drop it. There was no way I could have kept up in that class.

Well I hope everyone is doing great and enjoying there Labor Day. I am off and working on class stuff. I also took tomorrow off to finish my class stuff and to go to for an ultrasound tomorrow. Not looking forward to going back to work on Wednesday.

items.title: End of an Era
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
With the launch of the last shuttle today it is an end to an era. I remember when I was a teenager seeing them test the Enterprise and then launching all the shuttles. I never got to go see a shuttle launch in person. However, from Tampa on many occasion I could step outside and it was just a few minutes and I could see the launch from where I lived. I can truly say I lived and witnessed the whole shuttle era. Through all the high points and the two low points. I disagree with the decision to discontinue the shuttle program. But, what is done is done. I look forward to witnessing the birth of the next program.

items.title: Welcome 2011
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, it is another year. I pray this one is a lot better than last year. I was reflecting last night how if I was still in law enforcement, I would have only 4 years to go to full retirement. However, I don’t know if I would have lived longer than 5 years after that. I would probably be about 250 to 260 pounds. Plus have full blown diabetes and still probably would have had glaucoma in my right eye. On top of that the citizens of Hillsborough County would have drove me nuts.

I am thankful to the Lord for telling me to leave when I did. I have pre-diabetes. Still have glaucoma in my right eye and have lost 26 pounds in the last year. I did it slowly over the course of the year and I am maintaining my weight. I plan on talking to my doctor again and see if I can go back on the Phenteramine. I seem to hold my weight once I lose it thanks to the those pills.

I am hoping to pay down more debt this year. I am hoping. I pray that the Lord will give me enough of a pay raise to help accomplish a 15 percent reduction in my overall debt. I would like to also build up a reserve this year of at least 10 percent of my salary. I would also like to use cash to pay for as much as possible. By the end of the year I hope I can reach these goals along with being at 199 pounds in weight. I would also like to be able to start back to College to head to my goal within the next five years to finally graduate and get a job in the IT industry. My long term goal is to be living in Paris, Tennessee by the time I am 52. Let’s pray all this works out.

That is my short term and long term goals for the years to come. Hope everyone had a great New Year’s Eve. I worked but it was an easy night. So, easy I can’t even sleep today.

items.title: Sorry I haven’t blogged in a log time.
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Sorry I haven’t blogged in a log time. Been kind of busy with work. Never did I think retiring from one job and starting a new one in a new field would be so exhausting. Well, I am finally learning Microsoft Expressions Web. So, I am slowly and surely getting my old website back up into a new design and feel. It is still a work in progress and would like to know what you think of it. So, please stop by and take a look and let me know how it is going (http://michael.mitchelltribe.com).

Now about Facebook. I am thinking of quitting it. Nobody really contacts me on there. And all my old friends don’t seem interested in contacting me. So, it is just a thought.

As far as work is going I am on nights again. However, I have a schedule I really like. I work Monday night through Friday night and have Saturday and Sunday night off. My hours are pretty good too. In fact, they just changed last week and I really like the new hours 10PM-6:30 AM. I sleep pretty good, except when there is noise around the house. Well that’s about it for now. Hope everyone is doing great and would love to hear from everyone. Take care.

items.title: Been sick
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Have been sick the last three days. Had to call out from work the last two. Not 100% but about 85-90%. Will be back at work tomorrow.

items.title: Still working on the website
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, I hope people stop by and liked how the redesign is going. I am almost done with it. Still may be a couple of months. I love technology. However, I hate having to use so many different programs for different things.

This has been my second weekend off in a month. I can’t believe I have had two weekends off in one month. Next month looks to be the same. Also, I will start a new position at Moffitt at the end of June or the beginning of July. It will require me to work midnights again. But, I thought I would mind. But, I don’t. It means more money, not actually a pay raise but shift differential. This should add about 10000 in yearly income, at least I hope. Second, I will be working basically a Monday through Friday shift. I will be off every Saturday and Sunday night. I am looking forward to it.

I work on Monday, Memorial Day. But, that is ok. I will be getting time and a half. Also, I downloaded the new official, not beta, version of Microsoft Office 2010. I like it. It is way better than Office 2007. Only feature I miss is from Office 2003, where you can change the stationary in Outlook. I got it for 9.95 from the Microsoft Use at Home program through work. However, I will still have to buy a shrink wrap version as on of my computers I am using 64 bit for almost everything.

On the weight front. I have not lost any more, but, haven’t gained anymore either. I am holding steady. I think my body is becoming used to the Phenteramine. However, I am not showing any signs of needing it every day. I skip yesterday’s dose all together. My appetite did not increase so that’s good.

Well, that is it for now. Remember you can follow me on Twitter. Stop by my website and follow me other ways. I am going to strive to blog and twitter more through out the year. I am contemplating deleting my Facebook account. Because I don’t like their privacy policies. The only reason I use it because I have found a lot of people for my past.

Well, from me, Henry and Taco (my dogs), take care and be safe. And remember you never know when the Lord will call us away. So be prepared.


Quote of the Day:
Confidence and enthusiasm are the greatest sales producers in any kind of economy.
--O. B. Smith

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Why is it you can have one good neighbor on one side of you and in back of you and a very bad and annoying baby crier of a neighbor on the other side of your house. Had to finally tell that pesky noisy neighbor to stay off our property and complain to whoever he needs too about our dogs barking. Even though 2 of the 4 haven’t been barking. Since I put a bark collar on them when he complained the other day. Know he says they are still barking and they haven’t been and now it is the other two dogs. He can’t make up his mind.

But, his dog can come over to our yard and into our garage and pee in it. Had to tell him about the pictures I have of his dog on our property and he told me to get off his property. People should remember that when they through the first stone (figuratively, not literally) they should not be surprised when someone throws one back.

items.title: My Eye My Eye!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I came back from lunch and a co-worker asked why my eye was bleeding. I thought he was kidding. I went to the mirror and sure enough my right eye looks like it busted several eye blood vessels. I don’t know how it happened. It doesn’t hurt. I can see fine. Just looks gross. I hate getting older……

items.title: Still living
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Hello everyone I am still living. Just been working a crazy schedule this past couple of weeks. Also, been going to the doctors a lot. Trying to catch up from the year I didn’t have insurance.

Will have a lot more to say tomorrow. Take care.

items.title: This day went by fast
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
My first of two days off went by fast. I had a teeth cleaning done today and then went to the dermatologist. He cut off a suspicious mole from the bottom of my right foot.

One of these days I will get to work more on my new website. Not looking forward to going back to work on Thursday. As it starts a hectic four days. With the Zenith being my Friday which will actually be Sunday. I will work a double shift.

 

2 Thessalonians 1:3“[Thanksgiving and Prayer] We ought always to thank God for you, brothers, and rightly so, because your faith is growing more and more, and the love every one of you has for each other is increasing.”

I have to keep learning about this new program I now am using. Eventually, I think this new software, Microsoft Expressions Web 3 to be more flexible.

So, hopefully by June or July of this year it will be updated. Between work and everything else. I will have to find some time to read the books with this software and actually use it.

items.title: Tiger Woods
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I have two theories about Tiger Woods accident. First one, him and his wife got into an argument and he decided to leave. He then tried to show her and tried to hurt himself. The second, He was leaving the home while they were still arguing. She was running after him and probably hitting the vehicle he was concentrating on her and had the accident. If he was not DUI these are the only two plausible reasons to wreck in your on driveway.

items.title: Nothing New
items.content_html: Nothing new lately. Just been working alot. My foot feels about 60% better. All the pain is not completely gone. In fact it has moved. Will be working the next eight days straight. Hope to get to the website after that. Take care!
items.content_text: Nothing new lately. Just been working alot. My foot feels about 60% better. All the pain is not completely gone. In fact it has moved. Will be working the next eight days straight. Hope to get to the website after that. Take care!

items.title: Why are we thinking about pulling out of Afghanistan
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I never agreed that we should have invaded Iraq. But, since we did, I thought we should stay because we created a great environment for terrorists. Now that we are finally making progressive, I believe we should start an orderly withdrawal.

However, Afghanistan I agreed from the beginning we did need to invade and stay there until Al-Qaeda was defeated. Send more troops and finish the job. Charlie Wilson was right we need to take care of Afghanistan. Let�s get this done. Not pull out.

I am almost tempted to run for Congress. That group up there now is a bunch of idiots both parties.

 

Romans 5:3-4�Not only so, but we also rejoice in our sufferings, because we know that suffering produces perseverance; perseverance, character; and character, hope.�

items.title: What a week
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I am finished training. I start by myself on Sunday. And what a busy last three days this was. I am totally exhausted. I have one day to rest and then back to work I go on Sunday.

items.title: Last week of training
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
This will be my last week of training. I will finish my Chemo hood training this coming Friday. And starting on Sunday I will be working solo. Everything else has been going fine. Henry and Taco, my dogs are doing great. I have been losing weight and have lost 8 pounds. It is an exciting time.

Philippians 4:4�Rejoice in the Lord always. I will say it again: Rejoice!�

items.title: My Verizon Fios TV is in
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
My Verizon Fios TV is in and so far so good. The Tech was very good and professional. He checked every outlet to make sure the signal was good for every TV. Something Brighthouse never did and he found a couple of problems with a couple of outlets. Everything fixed and the best picture I have ever seen.

Also, work has been going great. I start training in the IV room next Wednesday and next Friday I get my first paycheck. Going to try and stay off my feet the next couple of days.

Also, tomorrow I start taking Meridia. It is a prescription weight loss pill lets hope I don�t have any side effects from it and that it works.

items.title: First Week
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: My first week at Moffitt was great. Start my second week on Monday. There are only two things I do not like. First, my feet have been killing me. I have to get used to standing about 7 hours a day. Second, starts Monday, the parking. I will be parking a long way from the hospital. Other than that I like the people I work with and it is easier than UCH.

items.title: First Day of Work
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I love Moffitt. My first day was great looking forward to going back tomorrow.

items.title: Getting rid of Brighthouse
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I signed up today for Verizon Fios TV. I am tired of Brighthouse pictures freezing up, crappy compression and terrible sound. So, I am giving Verizon a chance at the old TV. I love their Fios Internet, don�t have problems with my home phone and my cell phone service is quite good from them. As of August 21, 2009 I will be Brighthouse free. Also, I will be actually saving some money.

items.title: Trying to update website
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I am attempting to update my website. I have started work on it and hope to have it done by this weekend. My last free weekend before I start back to work. I am looking forward to work at Moffitt. I am officially an employee as of Monday, August 10, 2009.

items.title: Exciting news ...
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I just got hired at Moffitt Cancer Center. I start August 10, 2009. Thank you everyone who kept me in their prayers. Thank you Mr. Witas, Mr. Johnson and Michele Hobbs, the HR representative. And the biggest thanks to the Almighty Lord!!!!

items.title: I have Graduated
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, it is finally over. I graduated with honors. Now looking for a job. Hopefully I will find it soon.

items.title: This is funny but so true of America today.
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: America's corporations and its employees better wake up and provide truly exceptional service. The way people are becoming, we Americans will be laughingstocks of the world pretty soon.

items.content_html: Slow night at UCH.
items.content_text: Slow night at UCH.

items.title: Brazil
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I have been looking at Brazil lately. Would like to visit there. I have a passport that has never been used. However, finances will not hold up to such a strain.

items.title: What is up with the job market lately
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I thought things were getting better. Now, I am not sure. I will be graduating next month for my year long program. However, there are no job openings available on the near horizon. My bank account is getting real real real low. Only if my waistline would shrink as fast as my bank account.

items.title: Catching up on DVDs
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Catching up on some DVD watching. Watch Flywheel and Facing the Giants. Both great movies.

items.title: Two down and Seven to go
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Two weeks down and seven more to go. I must be walking ten miles a day. Yes, I said 10 miles. My feet are slowly becoming accustomed to it. However, for some reason they really hurt today. But, only have only lost 2 pounds. I have Oatmeal for breakfast, no snacking, then lunch about 2PM after I am off. Then dinner. I eat nothing after 8PM. Need to lose more.

By the way starting Tuesday, I have to start my clinical at 3PM to 9PM. Not to crazy about that.

items.title: Long Week
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Had a long week and looking forward to next week. Had a great Pharmacy Technician Advisory Meeting on Thursday. Great food and great discussion.

<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->

items.content_text: Awesome movie, so so dinner at Mitchell's fish market.

items.content_text: Just saw the newest Star Trek! Awesome!!

items.title: Latest KFC Promotion with Oprah
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Will this is a farce. Now KFC has Welched on their deal and Oprah played it along too. NO REAL Free meal for the grilled chicken USA. Last time I visit KFC.

items.title: Why
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I have blogged about this before but, I have to let out anger again. How come when you owe companies they want their money today? However, whenever you have a legit reason and qualify for a refund they make you jump through hoops and paperwork. Then take a week or more to give you back your money?

Lesson learned..Never Never buy an AMC Gift Card online. Never Never eat at Boston Market in Brandon.They never did refund my money. Never Never use Walgreens ink refill service.

items.title: Having a hard time
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Having a hard time getting in the mood to study for my last test. Have over hundred words to study in less than two days. I do not think it will happen.

items.title: PTCB Exam
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I passed the exam. I took me a little over an hour to do. But, I did it. Won't have exact grade until May 22, 2009. But, I am now a CPht. Plus, I only have one class exam left and my clinical.

items.title: I fear Chrysler is gone.
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: If this is the car Chrysler thinks that will save it. I think there is no hope. I would not buy this Fiat made car with a Chrysler icon on it. I would get a horse and buggy before I would buy this ugly thing. Gas efficient or not.

items.title: Telephone Bills and the fee/tax scam
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: How can a telephone bill go up month after month when you have changed nothing? Sure it only goes up by twenty or thirty cents here and there and it always seems to be in the tax section. Can they imagine one more fee/tax to come up with? My service is great Verizon but your nickel and diming is getting a little ridiculous! If Verizon did not have Fios or a competitor had fiber to the home I be gone.

items.title: What is up with these rabid foxes?
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Where did all these rabid foxes come from. Hopefully, they stay on the west side of the County.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Poetic justice. When I was a deputy I hated going in there or even to the parking lot. One of his own drunk customers took it out.

items.content_text: I feel like this lady sometimes. I can really relate and was absolutely on cloud 9 for her performance. And the judges were right and I have never seen Simon actually smile and pleased about a performance.

items.title: Non-family
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Why does a husband of a cousin of mine think he can just barge into my room uninvited when I was showing my Cousin something and had no intention of showing the non-family member. It was nothing devious, sinister or crude. It was some information I only wanted to impart to my cousin. I personally don't care if they are married or not. If your not invited stay out! If my cousin wants to tell you later on, which she probably would have then fine. But, I did not want to tell or inform that non-family member. IF YOUR NOT INVITED THEN STAY OUT is the moral of the story and believe me I told him so. Had to vent on that one. And personally, I don't care if his feelings got hurt or not. Rudeness will not be tolerated. If you are that insecure than get a teddy bear.

items.title: Down with American Idol
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Fox network needs to make sure that American Idol cuts on time. I missed a full 5 minutes from my Fringe show. Luckily, I caught it on Hulu.com.

items.title: Somalia Pirates
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: We need to do something about these Somalia Pirates. I say it is time to send in the Navy to patrol that area full time and a battleship to bombard their lairs on shore.

items.title: Cant believe it
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, today was the half way point for my Spring Break. I really can't believe it. I wish it were longer. I also wish I did not have to take this Certification Exam.

items.title: Wow over a hundred years ago
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: This is thought to be one of the oldest videos ever to exist. You can download your own copy at the Library of Congress.

items.title: Thanks to my family
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Thanks to my Mom and Dad for the lunch on my Birthday. My sister for the ice cream cake and my brother for the gift card.

items.title: Its my birthday
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, its my birthday. Yep I am 40. Don't feel like it. Both physically and financially. Nothing big planned.

items.title: Losing the battle
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, today was a bad day for me. Not at school that was actually a great day. But, the day turned south when I went to the doctors office for my 3 month visit. First, I am losing my battle with losing weight. I have gained 2 pounds. Secondly, my blood pressure has been borderline for years. Well today my doctor put me on blood pressure medication, Benicar. I am taking Benicar for the blood pressure which is slightly elevated, Metformin to keep me from becoming a diabetic. My glucose is elevated but not considered to be diabetic and my triglycerides are high. So, I am staying on my Tricor. He says those 3 could be stopped if I lost a lot of weight.

items.title: My last fish
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: My last fish a Bahia Shark died. He or she not sure which one they were, was 6 years old and the last fish in our tank. So the little guy is gone. I will miss him.

items.title: Exciting week at school
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
It was an exciting week at school. We learned and operated on a machine called the EM24 by Baxa. Our school is the first school in the nation to have one. Usually you only find this machines in hospitals or home health care setting. By getting this training we are a step ahead of the competition.

Now it after a busy week of learning and test taking. I am taking the night off and watching a couple of movies. Take care all.

items.title: Busy weekend
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: It has been a busy weekend. I finally got my new monitor in. My old one gave up after 6 years. In fact, it would not even show anything today. I did not think the new one would be here until Monday. I went out the door and there the new monitor sat on the front porch. I was glad because without it I would not be able to do anything on my computer.

items.title: Blind Date
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I had a blind date tonight. Mutual friends setup us up. I had a great time and this is my first blind date that was a hit instead of the misses I had on previous blind dates.

items.title: Joes Crab Shack
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
My Cousin Tina and her husband took my Mom and me to Joe's Crab Shack. The food was excellent. I recommend the place for the food. I had the crab of course. They make an awesome Lobster Bisque soup.

However, we had to wait an hour and half to get a table and the service was not the greatest. That was the only negatives.

items.title: Space Shuttle Launch Seen from my house
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: It was great. When I move from Florida someday this is one of the few things I will miss.

items.title: It has been a year
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
A year ago my Grandmother was buried. It is a bitter sweet day. She was buried and today is my nephew's birthday.

I am still handling the probate of my Grandmother's will and that has been going on for the last seven months. I can't wait to get that done.

items.title: My Nephew's Birthday!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Today is my nephew Maxwell's birthday. He is getting big for 2 years old.

items.title: Tennessee Property
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I have placed these pictures on my web site on the photo album page. But, I thought I would also place them on my blog. These pictures are from 2006 aerial photos and where you see three bodies of water in a row that is my property. It is toward the upper center of the picture. All that cleared land and a small piece running toward the road is all mine.

items.title: Website finally updated!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: My website is finally updated and it will stay that way for a couple of months. Hope you enjoy. There are new features and pages. Have fun finding them.

items.title: Website
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Hopefully next weekend my website will finally be updated for a few months. I have just been very busy with school. Speaking of school, I can not wait until July, 16, 2009. Graduation day. Halleluiah! It will be over. And hopefully, I will have taken and passed the Certification exam by then too.

items.title: A sad lost for us all
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, I just got the news that Paul Harvey has passed away.

I've lost so many family members and familiar faces in the past three years—uncles, aunts, TV and radio personalities I grew up with, and my grandmother.

His wife passed away last year, and I’m convinced that when a man loses his wife first, he usually doesn’t live much longer. But if a man passes first, the wife often lives on for many years. I’m not sure why the Lord made it that way.
