items.title: Back to School
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well tomorrow it's back to school. I have another big test on Wednesday. Only 5 months to go until graduation and hopefully a job.

items.title: American Idol
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
This year's American Idol is not that interesting this year.

And on the weight front. I have lost five pounds over a week and a half. I am happy.

Also, wearing one of my suits that I bought last year when I retired, tomorrow. Have a big function and test tomorrow at school.

items.title: Website
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I know my website other than this blog, has been updated lately. I will try to get around to it either later this month or next month. I have just been very busy study for school and my National Certification Exam. As I will need a job desperately before the end of the year.

items.title: Good Week? Maybe?
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, as far as school goes it was a great week. I kicked butt on my tests. However, for the first time in my left I got a stye in my right eye. It hurts and itches like the chickenpox.

Praise the Lord he gave me an excellent Ophthalmologist. She had her nurse return my call and had an instruction sheet for a salt water warm compress and a sample of an eye antibiotic ointment. I picked it up the same day. Thanks Dr. Anglin. My eye still itches however, I think the stye is starting to resolve itself my lower eyelid is only 1/4 of its size since the beginning of the week. If I never get one of these again, I will consider it a miracle. This was my first time having one and I did not like the experience.

items.title: Wild week
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
It was a wild week at school. Had 3 tests. Last one I blew away. Glad of that.

I will be inducted into the National Technical Honor Society on February 12, 2009 at 9AM.

items.title: Another day another study day.
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Well, I am still recovering. I feel about 85 percent better than I did at the beginning of the week. Yet, I also feel tired. I guess because I am still studying.

items.title: Sick Sick and Sick
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: I have a wicked head cold. I haven't been this sick in a while. I feel like I have no energy to do anything but curl up in a ball. Ohhhhh to have health insurance!

items.title: Another day at school and me being sick too
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, I went back to school today after the long weekend. It was alright. I had a test and did very well on it. Missed only one question. Probably had something to do with me only getting 2 hours sleep last night. I woke up with a sore throat yesterday and it continued all night and got worse. I have come down with a cold and feel miserable.

How everyone else is doing great.

items.title: Study Study Study
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: That is all I have been doing all weekend. I can't wait until July I should be done studying and taking test after test after test. I just hope I find a job then.

items.title: Just thinking
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, I was just thinking of when I could update my website. It might be as late as March. With school and studying every day I keep pretty busy.

I did join Facebook today. We will see how that goes. I am going to try to blog more often. As I have started using Windows Live Writer and it works great and makes it a lot easier to post a blog.

Hope everyone is doing great.

items.title: School going good
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
So far this year school is going good. I just hope there is a job for me when I am done.

Did anybody make any New Year's Resolutions? I didn't I always say lose weight. I have almost given up on that.

items.content_html: Well today was my Mom’s birthday. I gave her a gift. Hope she likes it.Not much else going on. I did post something on New Years Day. However, it did not post. So I will post it again. School will be keeping me busy. We are down to two tests per week now and I have two projects I must do. Take care to all and hope everyone is doing great.

items.content_html: Well I am glad I won’t be seeing any election commercials for at least two years. I voted for one candidate based on a single very important issue to me. I was really not impressed with either candidate this year. I look forward to when Huckabee runs again. I just got my first report card for my Pharmacy Technician program. I have a 4.0 grade point average for now. I am having fun learning about the different drugs. We just finished all of are ambulatory/retail pharmacy side of the program. There was a snafu with our clinical/internships. So we will be going straight into the Institutional/hospital side starting Monday. Soon we will began learning to make IV solutions.

items.content_html: Yes I am still alive. Yes, I know the website has not been updated for a couple of months. Yes, I know I have not blogged in a while. I have just been very busy with this technical program. I have a test every Monday, Tuesday and Thursday. I have an average of 30 words to learn generic and brand names of drugs a week. I hope some day to update the website. Henry and Taco, my dogs, are doing great. I am still losing weight albeit at a much slower than desired and I plateau for a couple of weeks before taking another pound or too. But, I have and continued to change my caloric intake and my eating habits. My Mom is doing great and my Dad is still ornery as ever and still a pain in the butt.

items.content_html: Well, I am getting real tired of politics and the politicians in this Country. I am not voting for Obama for sure and I don’t like McCain. I personally do not like either choice. However, I know where McCain is coming from. Obama is a great Orator but that is it. When pressed he is never specific. I also fear he would give into other nations because he is afraid to get us in a war even though it maybe for the right reason. The Iraq War was wrong to start but we must finish it or breed a 1000 more terrorist that will hurt us. We need people in Congress who is going to not only say he is going to look out for the “little guy” but recognize who the “little guy” is and start telling big business about their many unfair business practices. Such as telling banks they are not going to charge any more ATM fees. It cost them almost nothing to run these things and if I bank with Bank A and go to Bank B because it is closer I should not have to pay. Because I can guarantee you that a Bank B customer will use Banks A ATM and it works out in the end. That is just one of the number of ways Americans are being bleed dry by Corporations. I have a book full.

items.content_html: Hello everyone, I started school last week. I am going to Brewster Technical Institute for Pharmacy Technician. So, far so good. I know I have not blogged or updated my website in a while. But, I have been pretty busy the last couple of months doing several things. Getting ready for school (i.e. physical, getting clothes and supplies). I have also been getting things ready to probate my grandmother’s estate so that my Aunt and me can get what was left to us transferred legally. Plus, I have been trying to lose weight. On those notes, school’s start was successful. This is going to be a rough program but I am learning a lot. Secondly, I see the Probate lawyer tomorrow and hopefully after paying approximately $2000 get Grandma’s estate done. That leaves the weight. I lost 14 pounds initially. I have gained 2 back but holding steady. I need to go down again. I had to start taking Metformin because by glucose reading was on the border line. My doctor did not want me to get Diabetes type 2. If I lose enough weight and keep it off I could stop taking the medicine. Well, that’s it for now. I promise sometime in the future, maybe this weekend, I will get the website update.
items.content_text:
Hello everyone, I started school last week. I am going to Brewster Technical Institute for Pharmacy Technician. So, far so good. I know I have not blogged or updated my website in a while. But, I have been pretty busy the last couple of months doing several things. Getting ready for school (i.e. physical, getting clothes and supplies). I have also been getting things ready to probate my grandmother's estate so that my Aunt and me can get what was left to us transferred legally. Plus, I have been trying to lose weight.
On those notes, school's start was successful. This is going to be a rough program but I am learning a lot. Secondly, I see the Probate lawyer tomorrow and hopefully after paying approximately $2000 get Grandma's estate done. That leaves the weight. I lost 14 pounds initially. I have gained 2 back but holding steady. I need to go down again. I had to start taking Metformin because by glucose reading was on the border line. My doctor did not want me to get Diabetes type 2. If I lose enough weight and keep it off I could stop taking the medicine.
Well, that's it for now. I promise sometime in the future, maybe this weekend, I will get the website update.

items.content_html: Well, I just got a call from the dermatologists office. The area the cut from my leg was just a simple skin tag. However, the area they cut on my back was skin cancer and according the the biopsy it was the best kind of skin cancer that does not spread. Also according to the biopsy they cut out all of the area as it was contained in the specimen.

items.content_html: Went to the dermatologist yesterday and he cut a piece of skin cancer on my back out. It was small and he said they will have it tested to see what specific kind it is. But, he thinks it is a basal cell carcinoma. He said this was good because if it is this type it was gone and it would not spread. By back is still in a little bit of pain. I will keep everyone updated.

items.content_html: I know it has been a long time since I updated my blog. I have had a lot happen in the last couple of months. First of all, I am no longer working at Walgreen’s as a photo specialist. I left to concentrate on Pharmacy Technician school coming up in a couple of months. I went on a vacation to Tennessee. Where I learned a lot of new stuff. Although it was an expensive trip. The cost of the rental car was unbelievable. I will be posting a few pictures in the next week or so. Since, I have been home, I have been busy on about three different projects and only one is not costing me anything but time. Then I come down sick with the norovirus. I wasn’t even on a cruise ship. I have been sick all night Thursday night all day Friday and I am finally feeling a little better today. I caught it from my niece who caught it from Chuck E Cheese. My dad was about an hour behind me. We both had a throw up fest for about an hour on Friday morning. Unfortunately, I won. Today my mom came down with it. I have been that sick since my food poisoning a couple of years ago. Chuck E Cheese should be forced to close…….

items.content_html: My Grandmother on my dad’s side died on Sunday, March 9, 2008. She was my last surviving grandparent. The viewing is tomorrow, March 14, 2008 at 6PM for non family and 5PM for family at the Garden of Memories in Tampa. The graveside funeral is Saturday, March 15, 2008 at 10AM with a wake at my parents house following the service. Below is the obituary:Opal M. MitchellJune 08, 1913 - March 09, 2008MITCHELL, Opal M., 94, of Lakeland and Tampa, passed away on March 9, 2008. She was preceded in death by her husband, Harry L. Mitchell and a daughter, Alva Josephine Blair. She is survived by her daughters, Shirley Pipkins and Sandra Kelley; a son Steven; 20 grandchildren; 25 great grandchildren and numerous great great grandchildren and a sister-in-law Louise Davis. Mrs. Mitchell was a Baptist by faith. Friends may visit at the Garden of Memories Funeral Home, Tampa, on Friday, March 14, 2008 from 6 to 8 PM. A graveside service will be held on Saturday at 10 AM at Myrtle Hill Memorial Park. Should friends desire memorial contributions may be made in her memory to Good Shepherd Hospice 105 Arneson Ave. Auburndale, FL 33823. Words of comfort may be expressed at http://www.gardenofmemoriestampa.com

items.content_html: Well I finally got a part time job just to have something to do. I am working at Walgreens in the photo department. I am training this week. So, it has been hectic and more like full time hours. I hope to get into the regular rhythm of things next week so that I can update the web site. Also, Please everyone keep my Uncle Wallace and my Grandma Mitchell in your prayers. Both are sick and in hospitals. My Grandma is in a hospice home so it may just be a matter of a couple months to weeks to days before she passes. I so here in the emergency room a week ago and I was crying by the time I left there. She is 94 years old and she did not even recognize me.

items.content_html: Hello all! I know it has been sometime since I updated you all on my blog. I am starting to enjoy my retirement. I think it grows proportionally to the fact I am finally starting to feel much better from my sinus surgery. I had lunch with my good friends Linda and Heinz Asmuss the other day and we had a great time. Heinz and I worked at FHP together until he retired. As far as my continuing plans going forward. I should be starting my Pharmacy Technician school in August. I have been trying to get just a small time no big deal part time job. However, with the economy the way it is. Not much luck. I may have to dig a little deeper into my retirement then I wanted. But, I have set a limit to which I will go no further. Plus if everything works out right in the end or close to it I will be able to regain what I take and then some. Hopefully, I will be updating my website this weekend. items.content_html: Well, it has been over a month since I have retired. What have I been doing? I had my surgery and have had a rough time healing from it. Other than that not much. I did apply for some part-time jobs just to keep me busy until August when I start Pharmacy Tech School. I also started walking and have lost 4 pounds I know not a lot of weight but it is a start. I did visit Linda and Heinz Asmuss yesterday. Heinz was a trooper with me and retire 7 years ago. I have not seen him in about 3 or 4 years. Him and his wife travel the country in their travel trailer. Linda and Him are doing great. We had a great visit yesterday. I have my only job interview tomorrow back at Sears. I applied for a part-time cashiers job. They are the only one to give me an interview so far. I have not worked for Sears since I was in College before joining the Florida Highway Patrol. Highway Patrol.

items.content_html: Hello all! I know I have not updated you all in a while. I have been recovering from that sinus surgery. I have had some bad side effects and my recovery has not been stellar. I am still in recovery mode but last night was the first time I actually got good sleep and did not feel I was suffocating. The ENT Surgeon has been great. He has fit me in at the drop of a dime. He told me yesterday I was still healing and that he wanted me to see his partner just to make sure he is not missing something. He stated I just might take a little longer to heal. I see his partner next Wednesday. He also wants me to finish the sleep study with the CPAP. He believes that will help me sleep.

items.content_html: Well, it has been a month to the day that I have had my sinus surgery. At first everything seemed to be going fine. Then just after the first of the year I have had a lot of trouble. I did have the feeling that something was blocked in my nose. The doctor took care of that several times by cleaning the debris out of my nose. I feel great after that. But for the last week I have had to urinate every 10 to 15 minutes when I try to go to sleep and last night I felt I was suffocating even though I could feel the going in and out of both my nostrils. I have been getting very little sleep. The doctor has prescribed a sleep medicine for me. However, I have Lunesta and I don’t like the way this medicines make me feel like I am in a daze. I went to the Urologist and he said I have a prostate infection and wants to perform I bladder test on my for something called IC. However, I have been reading about this bladder test and people say it is painful and last for a long time. I am not ready for more pain. So, I think I am skipping that test. Well, I hope it goes downhill from here. I am about to hit a low point. My ENT has been great about taking me in on a dimes notice. But, I am about to go crazy.

items.content_text: It is Christmas Eve 2007 and I am in a little pain from my sinus surgery. I really want to blow my nose but cannot. I hope everyone else has a safe and great Christmas Eve. Remember the reason for the season the Birth of Jesus Christ!

items.content_html: Here is a picture of me two days after nose surgery. The packing is catching anything running from my nose. I know yuck. I have to change it about two to three times a day.
items.content_text: Here is a picture of me two days after nose surgery. The packing is catching anything running from my nose. I know yuck. I have to change it about two to three times a day.

items.content_html: I took my exam on Wednesday morning. Thursday, I received a call and was told I did totally awesome on the exam. My name is going on the list for the Pharmacy Technician school starting in August of 2008. I prayed that I would do well and pass and the Lord answered.
items.content_text: I took my exam on Wednesday morning. Thursday, I received a call and was told I did totally awesome on the exam. My name is going on the list for the Pharmacy Technician school starting in August of 2008. I prayed that I would do well and pass and the Lord answered.

items.content_html: I had my sinus surgery yesterday. It went well, except that I had to stay all day in the hospital. The doctor was worried about the anesthesia and my sleep apnea. I am in very little pain. But the best part is I can breathe again. I finally got released from University Community Hospital at 9:30PM last night. Today I have been recuperating at home. I have watched three DVDs Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix—5 stars out of 5The Bourne Ultimatum—-5 stars out of 5and The Simpsons the Movie—3 stars out of 5. Hope everyone is done with their Christmas shopping and remember the reason for the season the Birth of Christ.
items.content_text:
I had my sinus surgery yesterday. It went well, except that I had to stay all day in the hospital. The doctor was worried about the anesthesia and my sleep apnea. I am in very little pain. But the best part is I can breathe again.
I finally got released from University Community Hospital at 9:30PM last night. Today I have been recuperating at home. I have watched three DVDs
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix---5 stars out of 5
The Bourne Ultimatum----5 stars out of 5
and The Simpsons the Movie---3 stars out of 5.
Hope everyone is done with their Christmas shopping and remember the reason for the season the Birth of Christ.

items.content_html: I took my exam today for entrance into the Pharmacy Technician at a local technical school. I will know tomorrow how I did. I feel fairly good about it. Also, I am anticipating a good sinus surgery on Friday.

items.content_html: Well, it is official as of 16 minutes ago. I have retired from my law enforcement career of 18 years at 6PM tonight. I thought this day would come 7 years from now. However, I could not take it anymore. So after a lot of reasons and thought I decided it was time to go. I took early retirement. I will move on to the next stage in my life as far as jobs/careers in the next few coming months or weeks. I will let you all know what develops. As of now I am just a civilian once again. Well, I am off. I am now going to go to my niece, Alexus' School Christmas concert.

items.content_html: I start my last two days at my job before my retirement on Thursday, December 13, 2007 at 6PM. I am looking forward to it. I also have been studying for an exam I am going to be taking next week with my new career. Lets hope I pass, this will determine a lot. On the DVD front I watched Ghost Rider the other day and I give it 3.5 stars. Other news this month. I lost a good friend. Why? I have no idea. I wish her well. Well blog more in the next few days. Take care to all.

items.content_html: Well, I have updated the website. Most of you probably have noticed that I have a retirement date on my calendar. Yes it is official. I will be retiring after 18 years in Law Enforcement/Government work. I will hopefully making an announcement about my next career in the next few weeks. Until then I have been enjoying my time off with a few movies listed below and have rated them according to my scale. 4 stars for excellent down to no stars. Firehouse Dog—–21/2 starsThe Debry Stallion–2 starsFantastic 4 Rise of the Silver Surfer—4 starsHairspray—2 starsMeet the Robinsons—3 starsI Now Pronounce you Chuck and Larry—2 starsRatatouille—-4 starsTransformers—-4 starsThe Invisible—11/2 stars

items.content_html: Hello all. I know it has been a while since, I last updated everyone. I have been extremely busy with work and I will be taking early retirement, as soon as November if things do not change. I hope everyone is doing well. I will try updating my website in September.
items.content_text: Hello all. I know it has been a while since, I last updated everyone. I have been extremely busy with work and I will be taking early retirement, as soon as November if things do not change. I hope everyone is doing well. I will try updating my website in September.

items.content_html: I have been working alot lately. I haven’t had time to do anything. I did go to the doctor reference my hemmorhoid surgery. He checked me and stated everything is healing as expect. It was just going to take alot of time. I can’t stand work anymore. But, I drone on. I have bills to pay. I am still debating whether to retire early in about two years or stick out the seven years and five months I have to go. Some days I don’t think I can make it to the end of my shift. I have finished a great book while working overtime a couple of days. The name of it was Freakomonics. It was quite interesting. I am now reading Glorious Appearing the 12th book in the Left Behind Series. Well, I am tired. Take care to all my family.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: <title></title>Well, it is official I am sick of doctors, taxes and the rich. You know I am also sick of people wanting you to do your job and give them the excellent service they think they should receive. But, when expect the same thing you get anything but excellent service.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I wish to congratulate my friend Christopher Soleau. He will be retiring on July 12, 2007. He is taking a better job and will be successful at it, I know. Congratulations Chris!

[Listening to: Flowers in October - Tim Janis - An American Composer in Concert (06:24)]

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
The website is updated! The website is updated, FINALLY!

I know it has been a few months. But, I finally did it. I have been great the last few days. My surgery I had on April 5, 2007 is finally paying off. I have been going to the bathroom with very little trouble finally. I hope I don't have to have that surgery again.
Other than that I have been working alot. I think last month was my first full month of work in a very long time. This month will probably be the same, except I will be going in late one day. I have to get my passport and help my mom and dad get theirs.
I hope all my family and friends are doing fine. Drop my an E-mail.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: <title></title>Well, my brother tells me that Spiderman 3 is a great movie. I haven't seen it yet and it looks like it might be a while before I do. I have been working alot lately. Plus I am not completely healed from surgery. It only bothers me now when I go to the restroom. Other than that nothing much else has been going on. I have been contemplating retiring early. I can retire after 25 years with full benefits. That is seven years and approximately 9 months away. I just don't know how much more I can take. I am thinking about staying another 2 years. Then starting something new. I am not sure yet. Hope everyone is doing great and I know I will get to the website as soon as I get a full day off.

items.content_html: Well, today was the first day I saw the surgeon since my surgery. He advised everything was healing nicely and that it would just take time. He wants to see me back in two months. He stated by that time it should be completely healed. That was good news for me.
items.content_text: Well, today was the first day I saw the surgeon since my surgery. He advised everything was healing nicely and that it would just take time. He wants to see me back in two months. He stated by that time it should be completely healed. That was good news for me.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: <title></title>I know I haven't updated the website and added my vacation pictures. Still working on downloading them from my cell phone. I also have been in a little pain. So, I may not get to it until next month.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
The surgery may have been a success. However, after that first day when I was all drugged up on pain medications, I began to hurt and we won't even talk about going to the bathroom. After using the bathroom, I have to sit in a tub full of warm water for about 10 minutes. I don't regret having the surgery. But, I can tell this is going to be slow healing process. I am in pain but mostly after a bowel movement. I have been able to go today without any pain medication. I have been able to start sitting for a few minutes at a time.
The doctor doesn't want me to go back to work until at least Thursday. Luckily, I have had great friends and co-workers who have donated time to me. I thank every one of them.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I am feeling somewhat better. The bleeding has gone way down. I have pain when first standing up and using the bathroom. The pain using the bathroom is harsh. I hope it will get better over the next couple of days.
I will call the doctor on Monday and set a followup appointment next week. I have been sleeping a lot and hopefully will lose some weight.
I did watch Eragon tonight and I give it 3 out of 4 stars. I am going to sleep. My Perocet is getting to me.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: <title>Surgery a success!</title>My surgery was a success. It went much better than I expected. I had two external hemmrhoids, a skin tag and an unknown growth removed from my rectal area. The unknown growth is being sent to the lab. However, the doctor did not seem to be too concerned. I am in almost no pain. Just a little sore. Although I have not been to the bathroom yet for a sit down. I probably will be in pain tomorrow after all the drugs in the operating room are removed from my body. But, I am so glad. I thought and so did the doctor at first it would be worse. I will be back to work next Friday.

items.content_html: Hello all, I hope you like the couple of pictures I have uploaded. I have more I will upload when I get back home. I am typing this from Nashville, Tennessee. I am at the hotel. I will be leaving in a little while to go to the airport to take my flight home. I hope everyone is well. Also, 2 days left before my surgery and tomorrow is my birthday….I am getting old.

Also, 2 days left before my surgery and tomorrow is my birthday....I am getting old.

Took Henry to the regular Vet today. I had to postpone his annual visit because of his surgery. The regular Vet says Henry is in top notch condition.

I would also like to for people that I know to give up Google and use Yahoo!. I own stock in Yahoo! so I am partial. But, with only about a couple of exceptions. Yahoo! is better in my opinion. Try it for a month and tell me what you think.

items.content_text: <title></title>Well it was not good news today at the doctors. I will be going in for surgery April 5, 2007. I let everyone know what happens as the saga continues.

items.content_html: Well, I hope everyone likes the new look of the website. I will try to keep it updated more frequently. However, starting March 12, 2007, I go back to midnights 7P-7A. I go to the doctor tomorrow. I may need some surgery. I will let everyone know after tomorrow. My Grandmother is in the hospital. She has the flu and pneumonia. I talked to her today and she sounded better. I also found out my Aunt Shirley has cirrhosis of the liver. She is on a transplant list. This is my second aunt to have that condition and neither was a drinker. Well, I did not win the lottery. I was so hoping, so that I could build my dream home ( ). I also have been thinking lately that I want to learn how to ride a horse and a camel. I also want to own both since I do own 15 acres in Paris, Tennessee. Both have pros and cons and are ridden with the same training, with a couple of differences in the camel (giving commands for the camel to lay down). I have found several horses I like ranging from $800 to 2000. Camels are little more expensive ranging from $550 to $10000. I wish I could retire today.

items.content_text: <title>Website Update!</title>The website update for March 2007 has finally been completed. Hope everyone is doing fine. I have been better, but surviving. Take care to all.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: <title>I know, I know</title>Hello everyone,I hope everyone is doing great. I am doing OK. I have been very busy the last couple of months. I hope to update the website by the end of the month. I was going to try and learn a new program to update my website but changed my mind. I have had other things going on too.Henry had to have emergency eye surgery on his other and only eye left. He is totally blind now. The eye itself is still there. But, the contents inside the eye have been removed and replaced with silicon. At least he has no more pain from his glaucoma. The eye vet said he is doing great at his one week check up.I hope to be going back to Tennessee at the end of March to check up and stay for a little while on my property in Paris, Tennessee.Take care everyone! Bye for now.

items.title: Well, I can't wait until next year!
items.content_html: Well, I hope everyone is well. If you haven’t notice the website has not been updated in a couple of weeks. It probably will not either. I am not in the Christmas mood. This year. We are having a lot of remodeling work done in the house and it has caused alot of chaos. We have not put up any Christmas decorations. Another reason is I will be learning a new program in the new year to create and maintain a website and just haven’t fooled around with it yet.Some breaking news. I am getting really fed up with work lately. So, if I don’t get a certain position I have been trying for I will be taking early retirement late next year. For everyone else have a Merry Christmas and remember the reason for the season, JESUS!

items.title: The season is coming
items.content_html: My favorite time of year is coming between Thanksgiving and Christmas. Hopefully, I will get a transfer in my job. I will keep you posted. Nothing new with me right now. Except on the medical front. I started taking a diabetes pill, Actos. Not that I have diabetes or pre-diabetes. But, my glucose has been 103 the last couple of times and it should be under 100. So, the doctor stated he wanted me to try this medication for 3 months to see if it helps with that and my fatty liver. They have found that by giving the pill before hand you are 70% less likely to get diabetes. I have also started dieting. Basically eating less. I gave up colas over a year ago and drink just water and tea. Though sometimes it is sweetened tea. The majority of the time I drink unsweetened tea. Well, I hope everyone is doing fine.
items.content_text:
My favorite time of year is coming between Thanksgiving and Christmas. Hopefully, I will get a transfer in my job. I will keep you posted. Nothing new with me right now. Except on the medical front. I started taking a diabetes pill, Actos. Not that I have diabetes or pre-diabetes. But, my glucose has been 103 the last couple of times and it should be under 100. So, the doctor stated he wanted me to try this medication for 3 months to see if it helps with that and my fatty liver. Well, I hope everyone is doing fine.

items.title: Sick
items.content_html: Well, this time I am sick with a chest cold. This has not been my year in reference to being healthy. As far as work. I had today off because of overtime and the company not wishing to pay. I have a 4 day weekend. Which is good. Since I have been in bed sleeping most of the day and coughing. I have no sick time left. So, good thing I got sick on my days off…..NOT!I am thinking of taking early retirement. If I do it won’t be until sometime next year.

items.title: Work
items.content_html: I have been out of work last Wednesday, today I went in for a couple of hours then left and will be gone again tomorrow. I had a blood exposure at work and taking the PEP (post exposure prophylaxis) medication. This medication makes my stomach sick/nausea. Now it is giving me diarrhea. So, until these things clear up. I am out from work.

items.title: Why Why Why can't companies do better at providing support!
items.content_html: First of all this is going to be a rant. I was watching channel 52 ABC family, one of my new favorite shows of Kyle XY, and the the channel goes blank. So, I check the other TV. Yep, it is blank too. So, I call Brighthouse to let them know. After spending 15 minutes on the phone, I get this nice lady who says “I haven’t heard of a problem with that channel. But, I schedule you an appointment to have a technician come out to your house to check your cable.” I state there is nothing wrong with the cable. Both TV’s are doing it and all the other channels are fine. It is the signal. “Well we have to schedule you an appointment for a technician to come and check the schedule.” No please don’t because by the time they get here someone will figure out the channel is down and fix the problem. Don’t you people have someone control room monitoring all the channels? No response. Just let them know the channel is down. Thank you and goodbye. The channel then comes up for about 10 seconds then goes out again. Customer service and technical support need to improve at corporations as far as letting one hand know what is happening and then post for customers to know immediately. Not 5 days after the problem is fixed.

So, I broke down and bought a new computer and it should be here next week. Hope everyone is doing fine. Take care and be safe.

items.title: Finally!
items.content_html: Well, the website is finally updated. It will stay that way for at least through September 2006. I have one more week before I am going to check on my property in Tennessee. I will post plenty of pictures. My Mom and Dad are coming with me this time. They want to check Tennessee out. I watched The Passion of Christ yesterday. This is only my second time watching it and I can not watch it without crying. I just think Mel Gibson did a very accurate recreation. How accurate, we will find out and it could be anytime. As far as work. I keep thinking I am not going to make it another 8 years and 5 months. It will be a day by day task. After doing the same job and profession for almost 17 years it gets a little old and I am never amazed by people anymore. [Listening to: Start of Something New - Troy and Gabriella - High School Musical [Soundtrack] (03:17)]

[Listening to: Start of Something New - Troy and Gabriella - High School Musical [Soundtrack] (03:17)]

items.title: Feeling Much Better!
items.content_html: Well, I was supposed to work all weekend. That didn’t happen. I went to the emergency room Thursday night and was admitted to the hospital. I finally got released on Saturday Afternoon. I even passed out in the emergency room and bit my lip. I don’t remember passing out. But, I do remember the lip because it hurt when I woke up. The diagnosis is unclear. I believe it was either food poisoning or diverticulitis. The emergency room personnel, according to my dad, were treating me like it was a heart attack. I knew it was not that. All because I said my chest hurt. My chest hurt because I had be vomiting for an hour before going to the emergency room. So, the final outcome: I feel better and looking forward to going back to work. I have 3 doctors appointment next week for follow up. Oh and by the way no heart attack that was ruled out almost immediately.

items.title: Big News!
items.content_html: Well, I have been waiting for a long time to let everyone know about this bit of news. I wanted to make sure nothing happened to stop or delay it again. I wanted to make sure the chicken hatched this time. Well, here it is a am the Proud owner of 15.15 acres in Paris, Tennessee. I paid $28625 for it. The propery is great you can find pictures of it on my website under vacation pictures, Paris, Tennessee. What am I going to do with this property? Well, I am going to build my retirement house there. I have only 8 years and approximately 7 months to go to I am eligilbe to retire. I am looking forward to that. All of my profession is getting to the point where it is ridiculious and I can’t wait to retire. What will I do when I retire? Well, after a six month to year just relaxing. I may get a part time or another full time job. Depends on income and how bored I get. So, I have been waiting a while to tell anyone as I wanted to make sure I actually got the property this time and I did. I closed on it last Tuesday. [Listening to: All The Earth Will Sing Your Praises - Paul Baloche - Paul Baloche - Trading My Sorrows (05:11)]

items.title: Long time
items.content_html: Sorry I haven’t blogged sooner. But, since being back from my vacation I have been busy. This is the first chance I have had to sit down and type something meaningful. I have updated the website. The new theme for this month is Baseball. I have tried to establish that through out. I had a so so trip. Greeneville, Tennessee was not that great. The mountain views were awesome but that was about it. luckily, I am going to be able to finally purchase the land in Paris, Tennessee. So, Paris Tennessee will be where I am retiring too. I should hopefully close on the land by the 1st of June. The pictures of the property are on the Paris, Tenn page. Back to the trip. I also went to Asheville, North Carolina. I liked the city but not their road system. I went to the Biltmore Estate while there and had a great time. There is a picture of me feeling the snow. While in Asheville I toured the Deltec Model home and their factory. These are round houses and I am totally sold on them. I like the design and they are Tornado and Hurricane resistant. In fact, the Deltec homes have survived Charley in Florida which we went through and Katrina. I won’t have to worry about hurricanes in Tennessee but I will have to worry about Tornadoes. Well, this coming month will be a very busy month as you can see by my calendar. I will try to blog more. Take care to everyone and enjoy the weekend. It has been beautiful here in Brandon, weather wise.

items.title: Returned from Tennessee
items.content_html: Well, I have returned from Tennessee. I will posting some pictures on next months website update. I did not find any land to purchase and I would recommend not going to Greeneville, Tennessee. It was a dirty city and area. The background of the mountains was the only good point. While on this trip I went to Asheville, NC to look at a Deltec home. They are round homes and stand up to Hurricanes and Tornados quite well. I was very impressed at the model home and the factory where the components are made. I enjoyed Asheville, NC except the road system which was very confusing. I went to the Biltmore estate while in Asheville and liked the house alot. Well, that should be my last extended time off for a while. I want to build up my time.

items.title: Dr. Visit Today!
items.content_html: I went to the Doctor today as a follow up to my endoscope and colonoscopy. The verdict a polyp was removed from my colon and was benign. The growth in my stomach was Helicobacter pylori a bacteria that could cause me to have an ulcer. So, he wrote out a prescription for Prevpac. I take it for the next 14 days go back in 6 weeks and see if it killed the bacteria. Other than that I will have to have a colonoscopy every 3 to 5 years just to make sure there are no more polyps. My labs were showing elevated liver enzymes indicating a fatty liver. The only cure for a fatty liver is losing weight. So, I am going to have to start a modest and I do mean modest diet with modest exercise. I want to personally lose about 40 pounds. I took the prescription to Publix to get it filled they had to order it and it should be here tomorrow. I refused to use Walgreens anymore. I have had several negative experiences with them in the past. I do have to use them for my mail order because that is who the insurance uses. But, that is as far as I am going. I will use Publix and CVS if I need anything from a 24 hour place. One last thing, I am heading to Greeneville, Tennessee next week to look for some land. I hope it goes much smoother than last time. So be sure to look for pictures posted everywhere (i.e. this blog page and the moblog).

The growth in my stomach was Helicobacter pylori a bacteria that could cause me to have an ulcer. So, he wrote out a prescription for Prevpac. I take it for the next 14 days go back in 6 weeks and see if it killed the bacteria. Other than that I will have to have a colonoscopy every 3 to 5 years just to make sure there are no more polyps. My labs were showing elevated liver enzymes indicating a fatty liver. The only cure for a fatty liver is losing weight. So, I am going to have to start a modest and I do mean modest diet with modest exercise. I want to personally lose about 40 pounds.
I took the prescription to Publix to get it filled they had to order it and it should be here tomorrow. I refused to use Walgreens anymore. I have had several negative experiences with them in the past. I do have to use them for my mail order because that is who the insurance uses. But, that is as far as I am going. I will use Publix and CVS if I need anything from a 24 hour place.
One last thing, I am heading to Greeneville, Tennessee next week to look for some land. I hope it goes much smoother than last time. So be sure to look for pictures posted everywhere (i.e. this blog page and the moblog).

items.title: My medical situation!
items.content_html: I had to have an endoscopy and a colonoscopy today. This is after several months of my primary doctor telling me that my liver tests in my blood work were coming back abnormal. My primary doctor sent me for a ultrasound of the liver and then an MRI of my liver with another ultrasound. The diagnoses with the ultrasound and MRI was a minimal fatty liver and a benign polyp in my gallbladder. Well, my doctor was going to start me on Tricor to lower my triglycerides. However, after another abnormal liver blood test sent me to a gastroenterologist. He had me go to Labcorp and I gave 9 vials of blood. Well, guess what. Some of the tests were abnormal. But, no hepatitis A, B or C. Which I knew was negative. Well getting back to my scopes today. I had a good experience at the place it was performed and the doctor is very good. He did find a growth in my stomach and my colon. He biopsied both. I do have diverticula in one area and I have hemorrhoids. The later I knew I had. I got to see color pictures of everything. I am going to ask when I see him on February 9th if I can have a copy of them. His office is supposed to call me and let me know of the outcome of the biopsies. I feel fine except at the top of my stomach it is a little sore. Probably where he did the biopsy. I will keep everyone informed.

items.title: Happy Thanksgiving Eve to all!
items.content_html: Happy Thanksgiving Eve to all! I am doing great. I lost my land I was trying to purchase in Paris, TN but it fell through. I look at this as a sign that the Lord did not want me in Paris, TN. I am still looking in Tennessee for property to retire on and will be making another trip in February 2006 to the Eastern part of Tennessee in the area of Greenville, TN. I will keep everyone posted. Henry went to the Eye Vet again today for a checkup. So far so good. The Eye Vet did advise he has a small detachment in the eye of the retina. But, as long as he is not uncomfortable and it is not bleeding so we will continue on his current treatment. That is good news. The bad is if in the future something worse happens his eye will have to be removed. On other new, I have plenty of new DVD’s I am going to watch this weekend. I also have plenty and I do mean plenty of magazines to get caught up on too. I went and saw Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire. I was very very good. But, the ending could have been a bit stronger. Well for now that is it. Everyone have a great Thanksgiving and don’t eat to much.

I don’t want to to let the cat out of the bag.

items.title: Banks
items.content_html: Well, I am trying to buy that land in Tennessee that is shown on my webpage. I have been dealing with Fifth Third Bank for going on 2 months now. Still no deal. Well, today I was told that the loan has been approved all along. But, due to sickness at the bank or the appraisal not being done, we would have to delay closing. Well, the day before the actual closing the banks up and calls and states well this trailer that is on the land has to be moved first. Well, I said you people knew about the trailer and said it was ok that the seller have 30 days from closing to remove the trailer. Now it is not ok and the seller refuses to move the trailer first unless I give him 12000 in non refundable cash. Why can’t things just work like the supposed too.

items.title: Sprint
items.content_html: My cell phone hinge broke on Monday. Tuesday, I went into the Sprint PCS store and I thought I would be in for a great debate and verbal argument over my phone. Nope, I was pleasantly surprise. They ordered me a new phone since it was under manufacture’s warranty and I added the total protection in case my replacement phone broke for any reason. So far I have had a great experience with Sprint PCS for wireless. I just got an advertisement for their new EVDO card for laptop access. I am weighing whether or not I would sign up. I am not quite sure yet. I just wish they would add a tower or two in Paris, Tennessee. Then I will be all set.But, on the same token since GTE became Verizon. I have had great service with them especially their Fios Internet Service. I have had an occasional hiccup with this or that with Verizon. But, overall, not bad with all their services I subscribe to. Work has been rough lately. They changed my shift so that I can help train new hires. I got a slight bump in pay that is always good. Hope everyone else is doing great. Please keep my cousins, uncles and aunts in Connecticut in your prayers. They are going through some rough times.

items.title: Fianlly a chance
items.content_html: Well, I finally have a chance to make a post. It has been a while, I know. My Aunt Alva Jo is in the hospital. She is expected to live only the next few months. She has Cirrhosis of the liver and her liver is shot. My mother flew up to Connecticut this past week to be with her. I pick my mother up today from the airport. We have been praying for my Aunt and will continue to do so. At work I finally am moving from midnight shift to day shift after two and half long years. I start my new shift on Wednesday. Also, this month I am going on a mini vacation. I am heading to Tennessee looking at some retirement properties. I will post more about that later. In closing, I hope everyone is doing great.

In closing, I hope everyone is doing great.

items.title: Lots of News! None that great!
items.content_html: The doctor himself called me on Monday at 5:01 PM and said that the liver ultrasound came out abnormal and the radiologist recommends me having a MRI of the liver. On top of all that I have a polyp on my gallbladder. The doctor said he is not worried about the polyp on my gallbladder but will monitor it. He is sending me back for an ultrasound on the gallbladder in 3 months to make sure there is no change in size of the polyp. Today I find out that my Aunt Alva Jo is in the hospital. We do not know why yet? I am trying to find out more information. So far that is it.

Second, I just got Verizon Fios (Fiber) today and so far I love it. The installation went great. The installation guy was great. The order processing was a mess. Verizon really needs to get their act together as far as the ordering. On the bad news continues front. My $400 glasses have to go back. They have developed a wobble and have two little marks one on each lens. My work pair are in great condition and are very good. On the more bad news front I am going to have to purchase outright a new phone from Sprint. My brother ran over my dad’s phone.

items.title: Finally something good!
items.content_html: I finally got my telephone problems worked out. On July 5, 2005 probably a whole new round of telephone problems will begin as I reordered the Fios (Fiber internet). Second, thing of good news, I got my second blood test results back. No hepatitis B or C and my Iron levels are in the acceptable range. In fact, just as I told them, I have been inoculated against Hepatitis B. I go for the liver work on Thursday Morning. Third thing of good news got my new glasses back with the proper prescription so now I can get and have no sickness when looking down. This month just may end on a great note.

items.title: This still is a bad month!!!
items.content_html: I can not wait for this month to be over. I am sick and tired of all this bad news. Today, I wait all day for the Verizon worker to get to the house to install mine and my dad’s new Fiber connection. We are supposed to get 2 separate connections. Well, the guy shows up at 4:30 PM and acts like he doesn’t want to really install the fiber because it is going to take him at least to 7:00 to 8:00 PM. Second of all he tells me that he is going to only install 1 line. I tell him no he has a work order to install 2 separate lines. He tells me that this is impossible. They only dropped one line from the box to the house. So the house can only have 1 data line. I tell him nope that was not explained to us and we were getting two separate lines. So, I tell him to forget it. I call Verizon and they give me some lame excuse. So, I told them to cancel the order. They have me so mad right now. I am contemplating dropping them all together and just use my Sprint Cell phone all the time and getting cable for my internet access. This would save me alot of money.Second thing that ticked me off today. I need to get a ultrasound of my liver so I call a couple of places. The first lady was extremely rude. I call another they were helpful, but ultimately I got sent to a voicemail. So, I leave a message and as of yet have not received a telephone call back. So, I am going to try Friday and if I don’t get anyone. I am calling my doctor and tell his office to set it up.Is everybody as tired of incompetency as me? I know that people do not know everything. If the don’t know, just say it. If the don’t know, but will check with somebody do it. When I am at work, I tell people straight out, Sir or ma’am, I don’t know. But, I will check for you or you might check with so and so or even, I am sorry this is not going to help you, but I don’t know and I don’t want to give you any bad information.

items.title: A week of Bad News!
items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Well, yesterday was a day of bad news and today continued the trend. I went in for a physical back on June 2, 2005. The nurse from my doctor called me and woke me up after I had gotten home late and had only about 3 to 3.5 hours sleep when she called. She started out the telephone conversation Mr. Mitchell we need you to come in for additional blood work and the doctor is writing a script for a ultrasound of your liver. He thinks something is wrong with your liver and your liver panels are why out of wack and the doctor thinks you might have hepatitis. Well, to say the least I was wide awake then, I started to ask questions like how could I have hepatitis when I have had the inoculations for hepatitis B and that I was exposed to blood last year at work several times. But, I went for the 6 months of required blood draws and they all were negative. So, I am thinking the worst case scenario. After 4 and a half hours of no sleep and continuous telephone calls to and from the doctors office. The nurse finally calls be back and states that the doctor doesn't think I have hepatitis. He is having the ultrasound and other blood tests to make sure my liver is healthy and in good condition because he is going to start me on cholesterol medication. My cholesterol is 252 and my weight is a big factor in all this. So, I felt like a hundred pound weight have been lifted off of my shoulders. Then I wanted to punch that nurse out because she had caused me to panic. I go Friday for more blood work and will schedule the ultrasound for hopefully sometime next week. I will keep you informed.

Bad news week continued.....
I took Henry to the Eye Vet today and his pressure is high again. However, since he is in no obvious pain there is nothing that can be done except continued the medication and have him rechecked for monitoring. His eye has enlarged but otherwise is intact. The Vet believes that the eye enlarging is probably keeping him from being in pain. His nerves also might be dead which would cause no pain. So, I guess this could be considered mixed news.

Other bad things that happened last week.....
I had to go back to my eye doctor. The prescription and my new glasses were not working. Come to find out the prescription was too strong. Usually the doctor double checks the nurse's findings before I leave. But this year she didn't. So, after getting the proper prescription I took my glasses back and having the lenses redone. Luckily, I am not going to have to pay for it.

items.title: New Glasses!
items.content_html: Well, I finally got my new glasses. I will turn on the web cam next week on my days off for the World to see!!!!!

items.title: Yearly Physical
items.content_html: Well, I went in today and had my yearly physical. The checkup minus lab work went great. The doctor said only without the lab results yet I need to lose weight. Other than that he would have to wait for the lab work. However, I am headed for blood pressure and possibly cholesterol medicine if I do not lose weight based on last years blood result. I call back in a week to find out the blood work (lab) results.

items.title: Sorry!
items.content_html: Sorry it has been so long since I have blogged. I have been very busy in a two week period at work I have gotten 25 hours of overtime and work 109 hours during this time frame.I went to Disney World’s Epcot and Magic Kingdom yesterday. My mom and niece Alexus went also. It was very hot and muggy out there yesterday. They got a little heat exhaustion I believe. We had a good time but my Mom got sick on the way home. I have a lot of new DVD’s that I will be watching over the next couple of weeks. I will also have a busy schedule. I am hoping it will come down in the middle to end of June. So, just a warning I may not get the website updated for June by the end of June and may just update it for July. Well, I hope all my friends and family are doing good. Would love to receive E-mail from y’all. Take care for now. And by the way, I took a couple of pictures on my camera phone the other day and have posted them up on my MOB, so check them up.

items.title: Brighter days ahead and goodbye to some of my past
items.content_html: Well, yesterday I sold a good friend of mine my Ranger. I have had the Ranger with me for longer than I have had Henry. My Ranger was sold yesterday to very good people. I am going to be able to take the money at the end of this month and pay off a bill and a half. My goal of becoming debt free is coming closer and closer. My house buying is coming sooner and sooner like my retirement I also have been able to rest on these last couple of days off and already looking forward to Monday and Tuesday, my next days off. By the way speaking of Henry. I had to take him to the Vet yesterday. It seems he caught Kennel Cough during his stay at the Vets while I was on Vacation. He is on an antibiotic for the next 14 days. He will fully recover, Thank God!

items.title: Doctors!
items.content_html: I went to the doctors today. My blood pressure in my left arm was 150/104 by the nurse. The doctor came in and I was seeing him about a different problem. He checked me for that and then gave me refills on my prescriptions. But, I had to bring the blood pressure up to him. He took it and got a high reading in the left arm then took the right arm and got 132/85. It has been high since I started seeing this doctor for the past couple of years. He stated he did not want to start me on anything unless my readings stay consistently high. I have a complete physical in June 2005. So we will see what happens then. I will be trying to work a lot of overtime the next few months to save for Christmas. But, I wish doctors were better. I have a good couple of specialists (i.e. my allergist and my eye doctor) those are the only 2 I really trust.

items.title: Disappointed
items.content_html: Wednesday, April 6, 2005. We left and have arrived home from Disney World. I was disappointed with MGM and the Caribbean Resort. We did not have hot water our entire stay. It was luke warm. I like more hot than cold in my showers. MGM was kind of boring other than the 2 rides we went on it wasn’t worth seeing. The Magic Kingdom on Monday was extremely crowded, but I love the Philamagic show with Donald Duck and Mickey Mouse. That was a great attraction and the first time I had been there. Also on the plus side we had dinner last night at a German restaurant in Epcot’s World Show Case. It was a buffet and excellent. It was not quite as good as the Red Lobster on my birthday, but was good. I would eat there again. By the way we ate at the Lonestar Steakhouse on Sunday night and it was horrible.

The Magic Kingdom on Monday was extremely crowded, but I love the Philamagic show with Donald Duck and Mickey Mouse. That was a great attraction and the first time I had been there. Also on the plus side we had dinner last night at a German restaurant in Epcot's World Show Case. It was a buffet and excellent. It was not quite as good as the Red Lobster on my birthday, but was good. I would eat there again. By the way we ate at the Lonestar Steakhouse on Sunday night and it was horrible.

items.title: Epcot
items.content_html: I went to Epcot today, my first time there. I loved it. I went on the Test track and Mission Space. The hype leading up to the ride on Mission Space was leaving everyone scared including myself. However, once the initial part of the ride was over it was a great ride. I just wished it was longer. The Test Track was much scarier. I posted a lot of pictures on the MOB via my cell. I have been tired all this week. I think it is losing that hour on Sunday. Anyone one else with me?

items.title: April 4, 2005
items.content_html: Well, Monday was my birthday. I went to the Magic Kingdom on day 2 of my get-a-way vacation. It was very crowded. I got very embarrassed as my mom and dad took me out to dinner at Reb Lobster. First of all, my dinner was excellent. But, the surprise and embarrassment came as my mom told our waiter, without my knowledge, that it was my birthday so Jamie and the crew came over and sung me Happy Birthday as he served me a piece of cake and ice cream. I turned several shades of red. I was so embarrassed. But the cake was good and so was the ice cream. Overall not a bad day. 36 years old, I getting middle aged. 4 more years and I am 40 and 9 years 9 months I can retire. Scary!!!!

items.title: Disney World Here I Come!
items.content_html: Well, as I write this I am waiting for everyone to finish loading up my new 2004 Dodge Durango, so we can head to Orlando on our vacation. We will be staying at the Caribbean Beach Resort from today until Wednesday. The plan today is to finally get there and go to the Animal Kingdom. Until 2P then go check into the resort. Probably get some lunch then back to one of the parks. Probably MGM since they will be open until 10P. I plan on taking a lot of pictures with my digital camera and my cell phone. So check the website for more. I do miss Henry though I had to put him at the Vet’s to board. I hope he will be ok. Going to call and check on him tomorrow. By the way, I will post an audio blog later, which will contain more information on my new Dodge Durango.

items.title: New Website!
items.content_html: I hope everyone got my E-mail about and . Yes, is back. I stopped using Verizon On-Line’s home user website. I got 10mb of storage free but paid an extra $6.95 for 100mb more space. But, I was having a lot of trouble with it. So, I bought my own domain names and moved to hopefully a more reliable web host and a professional web host. I did my homework this time and found that this company has a solid reputation. So the new website can be found at . I am in the process of upgrading some pages in particular (i.e. the guestbook page). The guestbook page is not working properly right now and I am aware of this. I am having to learn a bit of website programming that I have not known before. So, it may be a couple of months before I have it up and running. I am also going to add a couple of other features as soon as I learn how. But, the rest of the site is up and running. So, I hope you will stop by often and enjoy. Also if you try to go to the old website on Verizon I will be loading a redirect page so you won’t have to anything. Please give me feedback via E-mail to let me know how you like it. Thanks.

items.title: Taxes
items.content_html: I hate taxes. I know they are necessary to run Government. But, lets tax those making over 250000 more than the middle class. I know someone will say we do. Bologna, there are too many loop holes. Lets go to a flat tax so everyone pays the same no matter if they make $1 or 1 million. Also, I getting tired of cable, satellite, cell phones companies and telephone companies raising their rates with these so called fees and taxes. They aren’t Government Taxes they are ways to collect more money from us.

items.title: The Oppressed
items.content_html: I feel Oppressed. Oppressed by Corporate America!!! LOL!!! Someone at work told be because they were black and I was waiting and working hard that I was oppressing his people and forcing his people to sell stuff to my people. LOL. I told him he was crazy. I mentioned all this to because lately I feel the pressure of money. I have been cutting expenses like crazy. I have lowered my car insurance (they did it I did not ask). A couple of credit cards I got them to reduce the interest rate. I am thinking about cutting my cable services and lower that rate (though that one will only be a few dollars). I am looking for a way to get rid of or lower my storage fee payments. I have changed cell carriers and getting great service with more features than Nextel (I went with Sprint PCS) at a lower rate. Well that is my ranting and raving now. I want to get a lot of bills paid off this year. I hope the tax man doesn’t oppress me and sets me free.

items.title: Cellular Telephone Service
items.content_html: As I mentioned in my previous post I bought my self a SCP 5500 cellular telephone with built in camera. I discontinued my Nextel Service for several reasons. First and foremost cost, second the direct connect service on Sprint, called Ready Link is superior than Nextel’s and lastly since the two companies are merging and my contract had been up for some time I went with Sprint. If you are not aware Nextel within the next 3 years will be converting everyone on Nextel’s network over to Sprint’s. So everyone will be back together eventually. Just one more thing my cell phone number did not change. The first week of January 2005 I will be sending a e-mail to all family and friends just to give them all my updated information. I do this once a year in case you lose it or something has changed. Take care and God Bless.

items.title: Welfare in Amercia
items.content_html: I was reading a thread over at DSLReports.com about new low housing homes being built in Oregon and the State was requiring the contractors to wire the homes for either DSL or Cable and that these residents received free or heavily discounted high speed internet access. Well, this started a flurry of discussion to say the least. Here is my two cents. I believe the Welfare System the way it is, is a total failure. It encourages people to be lazy, dishonest and baby factories. I have many ideas on how to fix it. Too many to list here. But, Welfare is Tax Fraud and Waste at it’s height. Well, just my two cents.

items.title: Hurricane Jeanne
items.content_html: Well, we are experiencing some of the worse that Jeanne has to offer. We still have power but we do have minor roof damage and the winds are continuing to pick up. Power has gone off and on several times. We have a lot of trees down too. I got off work early and have to go in again tonight at 6:00 PM. I will try to update you as much as possible. My mom and niece went to my brother’s house and they have lost power. During Hurricane Frances they kept power the whole time. This time we have so far. Well, going to try and get some more sleep if these hiccups stop.

items.title: Finally Great News!
items.content_html: Took Henry for his follow-up after surgery visit. His pressure in his eye is 10. Which is fantastic. The Vet said next week if his pressure is still that great his medication can start being reduced. The Vet said that we will know in about 6 weeks if he will regain any sight. If he does not at least he is not in any pain. He is learning to deal and get around blind.

Take care to all and just in case I forget Happy birthday to Krystal and her sister on Friday!

items.title: Henry Update Alert!
items.content_html: Henry has gone in for cyro to the eye procedure. He will have it done tomorrow and have to stay at the Eye Vets for at least two days. He has lost almost all of his sight. The Vet believes (as do I) that he is seeing shadows or has very diminished sight. This should be the last surgery for him if it works. If it doesn’t he will have to have the eye removed. So, everyone please pray it works. This is costing me at least 1000.00 or more depending on any complications.

By the way I am highly upset at AMC Theatres. I had a coupon for a free ticket and they would not honor it. They said they were not on the program. However, they could of still got there money. Just makes me mad.

items.content_html: Henry is nearly blind. He has some vision but not much. He is using his sense of smell and hearing the most. When I go back to the doctor I am sure that he will have one surgery left to stop the eye from hurting. I don’t think it will have to be removed but another option will take place. I have also noticed Henry stays by me more and is depending on me more.

items.title: Henry Update
items.content_html: Well, I took Henry to the Eye Vet yesterday. He stitches came out fine and the Eye Vet says all looks well on that front. However, his right eye the pressure has increased to 40 even after the increase in medicine. Unlike his left eye though his vision is good in that eye and it is clear. The Eye Vet has increased the only other medication he can to see if that will help. We go back in 3 weeks. I will have to take the day off or cancel a doctor appointment I have the following week and take him them. If the eye pressure increases or stays high I have 2 options both costly. One would be to try and use some type of cyro procedure on the eye to see if the glaucoma can be stopped and reversed (but no guarantees) the other have the eye taken out like the left. But, the last option makes Henry permanently blind although the cyro option could too. Either way his sight has just a few more months maybe 6 months to a year. At least when he loses the other eye he will be probably be healthier and happier because he will not be on such strong medication.

items.title: Important Notice about Hurricane Charley
items.content_html: We are preparing to experience Hurricane Charley. I will be working all weekend and do not know my schedule because of Hurricane Charley. My sister, 2 nieces and Chris (my sister’s) boyfriend are at my house along with my mom and dad. They will be here while I am working. To all my family and friends outside of this household you can call me on my cell. I will have it with me. Hopefully, we will just get a little bit of the storm. However, we are forecasted to get the full hit. So, this may be my last entry for a week or so. Henry Update:Henry is doing quite well on the eye that was removed. The surgical area looks a lot better than the pictures I uploaded last week. When I get a chance I will update more recent pictures. I am hoping we will get nothing but good news when I take him back to the eye Vet on the 25th of August at 1:00 PM. Take care all and takes to all for the prayers and concerns reference Henry.

Henry is doing quite well on the eye that was removed. The surgical area looks a lot better than the pictures I uploaded last week. When I get a chance I will update more recent pictures. I am hoping we will get nothing but good news when I take him back to the eye Vet on the 25th of August at 1:00 PM. Take care all and takes to all for the prayers and concerns reference Henry.

items.title: Henry Post Eye Removal
items.content_html: Here are two pictures post left eye removal of Henry. He is improving each day. The pictures look pretty bad. But, I can tell he is in less pain. Now, I am working hard to save his right eye. The eye Vet has increased his medication to get his right eye pressure down from 30 back to 20 or below. Let’s pray it works or he faces the removal or some other options that may not work on his right eye.

items.title: Henry Update
items.content_html: Today Henry had 2 Vet visits. The first to his regular Vet for his 6 month Proheart Shot (for heartworms). That visit with food and allergy medication along with the shot was $184. The second at the Eye Vet for his 6 month check up. We received good news reference the right eye it is doing fine with a pressure at 20 (not bad, no great but ok). However, the left eye which I have already spent ($2200) is in very bad shape. The two previous injections to kill the eye and keep any fluid from building up has failed. The Vet said this was a first. Usually after 2 shots no problems anymore. Henry is having the left eye removed for good next week. This will cost $800 and his left eye will be shut forever. Just when my finances were looking up with plenty of overtime from work it will be going to unexpected Vet bills and I am stuck in neutral again.

items.content_html: Ok what a weekend. I had to work this weekend with the exception of Friday night it was a slow weekend on the work front. However, my DSL went down Friday and getting Verizon to admit it was their problem took my 4 days 3 of them with little sleep. I finally had to call one of the field techs that has been out to my house before and ask him to help. 2 hours later on Monday he called back with someone on the line from provisioning and bing bang bam back in business. The lady at provision said one of the profile numbers were messed up and that had been happening alot lately. She asked me to try the DSL and it worked. I was overjoyed.

items.content_html: I was just sitting here thinking. I know that I have not been back to Church in a while. Not really because I don’t want to worship Christ. But, because of my job and because I always have been Introverted. I don’t like being around people. Especially, strangers. It takes a while to get to know people and once I am comfortable with people I am fine. So, this is one reason that I do not attend Church. There are a couple of more. Also, due to my job, when I am off it is down time for me and I have to admit I like to be lazy which links back to reason one getting to know people takes a lot of effort and I have been disappointed on many occasions with people. Which brings me to my third reason. People lie. I don’t mean a little “white” lie like that is a good color when it really is isn’t, but hypocritical lying. I deal with liars on my job all day long. But, then does this mean my love for Christ is any less genuine. I think not. I constantly listen to Christian music and shows while working, via the radio. So, I get my spiritual renewal and food from that source. I read the Internet visiting Christian links to gather information. I read, via e-mail, daily my devotional. So, yes I am being fed. Yes, I know the reason to attend Church is not only to be fed Spiritually but to fellowship with the people bonded by the same things that bond all Christian. The salvation Christ the Lord has given us and we should draw strength in that. The reason I bring all this up is I saw Passions for Christ a couple of weeks ago and it was an awesome movie. This movie can spiritually feed you for a while. It had me thinking tonight as every night, but more so tonight, that the suffering Christ submitted and allowed for me was unbelievable. I have to think that if I lived in the days that this happened and I know I would be follower of Christ back then to that I would have intercede somehow, even for a brief moment, to stop the pain and torture Christ had to endure for us. Yes, I know that I would have been killed but you know that would have been fine. Because I know where I am heading upon death. Death, even old age, these things don’t bother me. Pain, torture to me and suffering that Our Christ went through, that bothers me. If you haven’t seen the movie yet go see it. It was amazing to see and hear the audience. No one in the theater talked during the movie after the first 15 minutes. Some teenagers were sitting next to me and were laughing and talking and even making fun of the movies subtitles. But, after 15 minutes. There was absolutely no sound, other than the movie, and no one got up to go to the concession stand or the bathroom. The movie with it’s message is painful but necessary to sit through and really realize what Christ endure for us. Well that was on my mind and I had to let it out.
items.content_text:
I was just sitting here thinking. I know that I have not been back to Church in a while. Not really because I don't want to worship Christ. But, because of my job and because I always have been Introverted. I don't like being around people. Especially, strangers. It takes a while to get to know people and once I am comfortable with people I am fine. So, this is one reason that I do not attend Church. There are a couple of more. Also, due to my job, when I am off it is down time for me and I have to admit I like to be lazy which links back to reason one getting to know people takes a lot of effort and I have been disappointed on many occasions with people. Which brings me to my third reason. People lie. I don't mean a little "white" lie like that is a good color when it really is isn't, but hypocritical lying. I deal with liars on my job all day long. But, then does this mean my love for Christ is any less genuine. I think not. I constantly listen to Christian music and shows while working, via the radio. So, I get my spiritual renewal and food from that source. I read the Internet visiting Christian links to gather information. I read, via e-mail, daily my devotional. So, yes I am being fed. Yes, I know the reason to attend Church is not only to be fed Spiritually but to fellowship with the people bonded by the same things that bond all Christian. The salvation Christ the Lord has given us and we should draw strength in that.
The reason I bring all this up is I saw Passions for Christ a couple of weeks ago and it was an awesome movie. This movie can spiritually feed you for a while. It had me thinking tonight as every night, but more so tonight, that the suffering Christ submitted and allowed for me was unbelievable. I have to think that if I lived in the days that this happened and I know I would be follower of Christ back then to that I would have intercede somehow, even for a brief moment, to stop the pain and torture Christ had to endure for us. Yes, I know that I would have been killed but you know that would have been fine. Because I know where I am heading upon death. Death, even old age, these things don't bother me. Pain, torture to me and suffering that Our Christ went through, that bothers me. If you haven't seen the movie yet go see it. It was amazing to see and hear the audience. No one in the theater talked during the movie after the first 15 minutes. Some teenagers were sitting next to me and were laughing and talking and even making fun of the movies subtitles. But, after 15 minutes. There was absolutely no sound, other than the movie, and no one got up to go to the concession stand or the bathroom. The movie with it's message is painful but necessary to sit through and really realize what Christ endure for us.
Well that was on my mind and I had to let it out.

items.content_html: I went on a blind date this is probably my fifth or sixth one and all have one thing in common. They were not positive experience. I mean as far as the other company I was with the couple that set it up that was a positive experience. I enjoyed meeting my friend’s wife and enjoyed there company. But as far as the date. We did not talk that much and for a change they talked about their job all the time but not to me but to my friend’s wife. We probably said 2 sentences to each other. We just did not click from the get go. Oh well. But, I definitely think that was the end of blind dates. We did go see 50 first dates not a great movie but not bad earlier. I did find supposedly a great compatible match from eharmony. But I am not paying the 250 yearly fee or the 49.95 for one month. Oh well, I have decided I am content on being a solitary human. I have Henry my dog he keeps me going with his antics along with my faith. That should be enough.
