items.content_html: I am off tonight and tomorrow then back to the work world for 3 days of fun and money. I had to take Henry to the Eye Vet today. This was just a schedule follow up. But, last night something happened to his left eye while I was at work. I thought the glaucoma was back. His eye was shut up and the lid was swollen. I had fears of spending 1300 bucks just to have his operate on again. But, good news. The Eye Vet said both eyes the pressure was very good. He said that his left eye was inflamed but he did not think it was from anything to do with glaucoma. He said he could not rule out a pressure spike but more than likely since Henry is blind in that eye he either hit it or poke it on something. The Eye Vet gave me an anti inflammatory to use for 10 days. He said that no other medicine is needed in the eye because it is dead and the pressure is not a problem anymore. Henry goes back in 4 months, earlier if any problems. I am very glad because it saves me a lot of money.

items.content_html: I am off this weekend but watching my sick niece. I am not well either. I feel fine except my right foot. This is the second time this has happened to me. I went to bed Tuesday night and woke up Wednesday morning and my foot was killing me and it had swollen up. I hurt so bad I was limping Wednesday and Thursday. Thursday I told my supervisor I could not keep walking and limping. So, I came home 5 hours early. I hate to come home from work once there and especially since I was more than half of shift. I have been taking Aleve and it seems to have helped still limping. I am trying to stay off of my right foot.

items.content_html: I went to the doctor yesterday for a yearly physical. So far, I gotten green thumbs but we have to wait for the blood test and another test because there was a little problem. However, the little problem so far is not a big problem and the Doctor just thinks it might be a benign problem. I don’t want to go into too much detail yet. On the downside, they gave me the wrong prescription. I was supposed to get a subscription for Clarinex and they gave me one for Clarintin. Which is stupid I can buy Clarintin over the counter why would I need a prescription for that. Have to go to work early today. I have to attend some training. So it is going to be a long day.

items.content_html: Well, it is official. I am sick. Not the flu just a regular old sinus infection/cold. Henry is also sick. His allergies are exploding. I had to take him to the Vet today and spent $43.50 for his shot and associated medications. I hope everyone had a great Christmas. Both my days at worked were bad days, have volume of work. I got 4 hours overtime on Friday morning and was looking forward to getting home on time. The only comfort is that I will be getting paid for it. I think I will be taking 2 or 3 days of holiday time next month to have a very long weekend. I will be reinstalling a fresh installation of Windows at that time. How I wish I could afford a new computer. I want a new AMD 64 bit computer. I think I am either going with Gateway or Alienware for my next computer. Not that I don’t like DELL I will have more upgrade paths available with the other two. I still will recommend DELL even though they wouldn’t warranty my speakers!!!!!For Christmas I got some socks, gift cards and cash. I hope everybody got what they wanted. That is what I wanted and got. Henry got a chew toy. Take care everyone and maybe blog some more tomorrow if I feel up to it.

items.content_text:
Well, I hope that everyone had an excellent Thanksgiving! I did! The food was great!
However, my 3 days off Friday, Saturday and today have been just OK! Today I don't feel especially great. I have a sinus headache. Well, I hope it goes away by tomorrow evening I have to go to work.
Henry Update: Henry is doing great, even though he is blind in his left eye. He is doing, feeling and looking great. We don't have to see the Eye Vet again until January or February.
Saw an excellent DVD this weekend Pirates of the Caribbean. 5 out of 5 stars. I also saw "A Walk to Remember", "Powder" and "Drumline" on HBO. First time I saw them. The first 2, 5 out of 5 stars. The last one was not bad but not great either, worth seeing once. Take care to all and see ya!

items.content_html: I am after working Wednesday and Thursday for a total of 34 hours in a 48 hour period I am tired. I slept most of the day yesterday. I am off today through Wednesday. I have to get my teeth clean on Monday. Also, my computer speakers went out and Dell is refusing to warranty the speakers. They said they were not bought with the system. Which is strange because the came with the system. So I will probably shell out some money to Circuit City for some cheap but good speakers. Well, I am lazing around the house for the next couple days debating whether to wipe out my computer and doing a fresh install or wait until after the first of the year. I would like to get a new computer but financially unable at this time. See you all later.

I will not be working on Thanksgiving Eve or Thanksgiving but have to work the day after, the dreaded start of Christmas Shopping season. Henry is doing great in his left eye. However, the Eye Vet on the day I bought him said the pressure was up in the right eye and he has increased the number of medications. I take him back on the 18th, as you can see from my updated my calendar page. On a different note I am off this weekend and had planned to do a fresh install of my computer. I will put that off for a couple of weeks waiting on some new software to arrive. I might even have a blind date Saturday night, we’ll see. I have an odd schedule for Wednesday and Thursday. So Take care everyone and hope everyone is doing great! That is all for now.BTW I am catching up on all my shows that I missed while working this weekend. Also, my cable provider, Adelphia, is upping the rates. So, I am looking at alternatives if anyone has suggestions. Brighthouse is out of the question. Way to expensive.

items.content_html: Henry had to go to the Eye Vet. He has to have another shot in his left eye. The Vet stated he only had one other case where the shot to the eye did not stop the glaucoma. So I have to take him next week and pay another $200.00 to have the eye injected again. The Vet will just charge for the shot and anaesthesia. No stitches this time for Henry though. That Left Eye has always been a pain.I am off until Friday, going out to dinner with some friends Thursday night to Outback Steakhouse. Take care everyone.

items.content_html: Well, tomorrow is my last day off. Actually, I am kinda of glad. I am looking forward to going back to work. I will have a busy week ahead of me. Saw a couple of good movies while I was off, I bought them on DVD. The In-Laws and The Matrix Reloaded. I also saw Boat Trip but I sold it on Amazon. It was ok but not what I was expecting. Henry has to go to the Eye Vet again. I noticed his left eye, the one I just spent $700.00 on, looked funny so I called the Vet and have to take him on Wednesday. He has not been complaining about it but I rather be safe than sorry. Speaking of Doctors appointments I have to make a Dentist appointment to get my teeth clean and a physical that includes my flu shot this month. Well, this is it for now I am including a picture of me showing my beard growth I have to shave…….[Listening to: Somebody’s Praying Me Through - Allen Asbury - Somebody’s Praying Me Through [Bonus Track] (04:03)]

items.content_html: Ok today I am really ticked off. First off all I had to work 3 and a half overs of overtime today. Second, when I was trying to sleep my Doctor calls with the results of my CT Scan of my sinuses. The results everything looks normal and sees no problems. Well why do I still feel lousy and I KNOW FOR A FACT IT IS MY SINUSES. He is referring me back to my Allergists and when I go we are going to have a nice long long long talk. If I take a sudafed my sinus headache goes away. Now if it is not my sinus causing the problem way does this help. Why do I have the constant drainage in the back of my throat or the stuffiness of my nose another. Why? Why? Why? Doctors are not that educated in my opinion. I think they guess most of the time. On a better note Henry is doing great. His left eye is dying but he is no longer in pain and seems to be adjusting to just using his right eye. Well, I have to work this weekend I hope it is not like the last weekend I had to work. I need a break.

items.content_html: Ok this is the first weekend I have had off in 2 weeks. I have enjoyed it. Henry is doing well. He is too cute. He is trying to be so brave about seeing and you can tell he is blind on that left side. He always turns right to meet someone now. I have picked my fall lineup television shows I will listed them on my website sometime this month. Some have already begun. Well, this is it for now back to work tomorrow. Not to be lazy anymore.

items.content_html: Henry Vet Update: Henry had his eye surgery procedure today. The left eye had a pressure of 41 after the procedure 10 and the left eye will be dead in about 3 weeks. The doctor said the right eye is doing great and should have no future problems. So I think I made the right decision. I had a CT scan of my sinuses today. The results will be sent to my primary doctor. They better find something (bad that is) I am tired of having these sinues problems. I will be glad to have another sinues surgery. I always feel 100 percent better after having sinues surgery and it usually last for a year or more. I worked from 6PM to 6AM from Thursday night to Friday morning and then was on the go until about 8 PM Friday when I finally got some rest. I woke up about 12:30 AM Saturday Morning. I feel a little rested but probably will go back to sleep. Not this week but probably around the 26th of the Month I will probably see about updating the website. The Webcam however, will probably be offline indefinitely. That is all for now. Take care everyone.

items.content_html: Henry Eye Vet Update: I took Henry to the Eye Vet yesterday for a check up to make sure the pressure was staying down still. Well, no it was back up in the 40’s. So they medicine worked for a while. I have come to the hard conclusion that I am going to have to a procedure done just to his left eye that would basically kill that eye. That way he is in no pain. He will be blind in that eye but will not be in pain and not have to take medicine that is not working. I can tell when the eye bothers him he whines. The other alternative was to try a procedure that saves the eye. However, it is not guarantee to work and stick and it costs $1500 and up depending on how long he has to stay at the Vets. Usually it is 3 days. But, again no guarantee. Also, the Vet is unsure if he has lost any vision and is just see shadows in that eye. They have no way of telling if he has lost vision. The other procedure to kill the eye takes only a few minutes is not that invasive and will take about a couple weeks to kill the eye. Henry would only be on medication to help comfort the eye until it dies. This procedure costs $650 and is guarantee to end the pain. He will still have the right eye and the pressures in that eye have remained low and the right eye did not have complications. The left eye did and has had all bad things happened to it. The right eye was quite healthy when the cataract was removed and the cataract was very small in that eye. So, he will have one good eye. I think I am going have to do the least costly and ultimately the best thing for him. I saw a completed blind dog at the eye Vet the other day and he got around pretty good. Henry wont be completely blind just in the left eye. I hope he can forgive me for doing this but I think it will be the best for him in the long run. On the work front. I started with a new team and I don’t know anybody on it. The same nice enough but would prefer to work with people I know. We will see how it works out. Hopefully, a couple of friends of mine will end up on the same team and this would make it more tolerable. Also, at least on this new team I will have all major holidays off this year like Thanksgiving and Christmas.

items.content_html: Latest Update on Henry: I took him to the eye Vet today. Normal pressure in the eye should not be more than 20-22 according to the doctor. Last Saturday it was 50 in the left eye. Today in both eyes 4 so they need medication works. He has another appointment next week to check his pressure again and if it is still good they will reduce some to the medication he is on. My new job is great! The only thing that is bad is the are transferring me to another shift. They are short handed on a particular shift so I am transferred as of Monday. The bad thing is I have to work Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday and Tuesday. So I probably won’t be blogging for a week or two.

items.content_html: Went to the doctor today. I was right a full blown sinus infection. The doctor is trying a different strategy. I will be on an antibiotic for 6 weeks to see if the infection will be knocked out and stay out. I hope so. I am tired so I am going to sleep early tonight. Might try to update my website this weekend. We will see.

items.content_html: Hey everyone! So, I have not blogged in a long time. Things are very busy at work now. I am getting close to my on the job training period. I should be finished the first week of September if everything goes well. I have had 4 trainers before the one I have now and they were all excellent. The one I have now is great he is younger than me but knows what he is doing. He will probably be one of my supervisors in the future. On the health front I have to make an appointment. I think I am coming down with another sinus infection. I don’t really think I “fully” recovered from my last one. Doctors hate giving out antibiotics anymore. I think if they put me on one for 2 months. I would be definitely cured for a while or at least until the next cold. I also need to go back to Doctor Anglin my eye doctor to have my pressure checked. She was a little concerned with it last time and wanted me to have it re-checked in six months. Well, it is six months. So, I guess I will make an appointment with the doctor in the next couple of weeks and get the sinus infection and then see if he will give me a referral to her so I don’t have to pay for it. Well, this has been a long post. I will be off Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Saturday, I have been invited to a birthday party so I will be out at the birthday party on Saturday.

items.content_html: Well, I am off this weekend. Just a note to all, you will not see Webcam updates for a couple of weeks or may a couple of months. I am going to be re-installing my operating system within the next couple of months. I am having a few issues that I created so I will be resolving them with a fresh install. I probably won’t even attempt it until after the 4th of July weekend. So, for those of you looking forward to my annual 4th of July update it will not be happening this year.I may be buying a new computer this year if I do it will be around Christmas or at the beginning of next year. I might be buying a new laptop this year. I am not sure if I will or won’t. If I do it will be around the end of August or September. I am doing some budget restructuring so that I can still get my own house in 2 years or sooner. I changed my DSL service today I currently have 1.5 megabits down and 384 kilobits up. But, the telephone company says I can take my $133 monthly bill and cut it down to around $80.00 a month with a special package. The only things that will change is my upload speed will drop down to 128 kilobits and I will be switching my long distance carrier from AT&T to Verizon. But, the long distance is supposed to be unlimited so we will see.

items.content_html: Well, another day off. I did mostly nothing. It has been raining all day. Sunday is my last day of my first round of training in my new job. A good friend of mine today became Police Chief of Solcomb, AL.

items.content_html: I watched a DVD today called “The Recruit” not bad. Give it 3.5 stars out of 5. Henry got groomed today and I spent over over $170.00 today. Grooming and food for Henry. My Dell computer is losing it’s hard drive. The hard drive is failing. I have contacted Dell because it is still under warranty and they have said that they are in the process for the support people to come out and fix it. So if the hard drive does fail I will be offline for a few days. Tomorrow off again. But, I have to take my Grandmother to Inverness to the dentist. Yippee!

items.content_html: Well, I am back to work tomorrow looking forward to it. This is a long week. I work Monday, Tuesday off Wednesday and Thursday then go back Friday, Saturday and Sunday. I have been hiccupping since yesterday. I think it might be from the medication I am on. It does stop when I a sleep. Thank God for that. Once, I wake up it stays stopped until I drink or eat something. I hope it stops for go soon.

items.content_html: Well, I went to the Doctor yesterday and I am on 2 antibiotics, a steroid, cough medicine and I continue to take my Clarinex. When I am done with the steroid I am to start taking my nasal spray again. I have a severe sinus infection. This is one of the worst I have had in terms of coughing and duration. I go back in two weeks to see if I have improved. I have improved about 10% since Friday. I have four new DVD’s to watch this weekend. I also have some studying to do for my new job. Last weekend I watched some DVD’s that I had bought. Catch Me if you Can is OK. Emperor’s Club is OK and Road to Perdition was a 3 1/2 star one. I also bought A Few Good Men but have not watched it because I have seen it before. The New Ones are Windtalker the Directors Collection, The Recruit (looks pretty good), Atlantis Milo’s Return (also looks good) and Star Trek: Nemesis. Well, on the financial front my second paycheck was lower than I expected. However, I believe they started taking out for Insurance. So, I will have to wait for next month to tell how much of a pay cut I took. However, I will be over the amount I was making at my last job by the middle next year. The money I got from leaving my last job has paid off several bills. I wish it could have been more. I would play the Lottery, however, I have just enough money for expenses and bills next month. So, maybe next month sometime I will come up with a little extra money. Well, this was a long entry because I wanted to catch everyone up. I updated the website with several new photos, some new music on some of the pages and update a couple of the pages (i.e. the My TV Shows page and My Calendar page). [Listening to: Somebody’s Praying Me Through - Allen Asbury - Somebody’s Praying Me Through [Bonus Track] (04:03)]

items.content_html: I started my new job today. Everything was going fine until the last hour. I got a call from Personnel and said they did not have my initial application. I had to go down and fill out another one even though I could not remember all of the original information. They said that did not matter and that unless I wanted my start date to be tomorrow and be considered a temporary worker today I need to redo it. So off to the Personnel Department I went and filled out what I need too. Of course it was not as neat and thorough as my original because I was rushed and unprepared. But, other than that went about the way I expected. Tomorrow is going to be a long day. I have to be at work at 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM. But only a half of day training on Wednesday.

items.content_html: Henry had another check up today. The Vet says everything is going great. Also, I paid for a service call mailblocks.com to consolidate all my e-mail accounts to fight spam. They are supposed to have a great way of doing this according to several articles I read. So far I am not impressed. Good thing the service only cost 9.95 and that was for 3 years. items.content_html: I went to the eye doctor today. My prescription did not change. However, the doctor wants me to come back in 6 months. The pressure in my right eye is slightly higher than it should be. She thinks it was just the dilation. However, she ordered more tests for me. When I come back in 6 months it will be just for a pressure check. She wants make sure I am not developing glaucoma.

items.content_html: I worked a double last night. Have only had 4 hours of sleep. I had to take Henry to the Eye Vet for a follow-up. Some mixed news. His eye is looking good from the surgery and the other eye will be done next week. However, the doctor is keeping him, long term, on medicine for his eye for glaucoma. He is worried he might develop it, if hes not put permanently on the medicine. He says that it must be genetic. Because it is in both eyes. If it was just in his left eye he could attribute the narrowing of his eye duct to scaring. But, since the right eye has not been operated on yet it must be genetic. So to prevent it he is keeping him on the glaucoma medicine. I told Henry he better not go blind. Well, off to the eye doctor myself tomorrow.

items.content_html: Well, it is official! I am getting FAT again. I have gain back 10 of my 23 pounds lost. My blood pressure is definitely weight related. It has gone back up in the border zone. The problem with the Atkins diet is that it works as long as you really really restrict the carbs. Well, I can’t keep doing that. I am thinking about a diet called “The Zone.” I also need to start some rudimentary exercising. But, I hate exercising. When is a pill going to be available?

items.content_html: I just found this Star Trek personality test and it was pretty close. Below are my results: Star Trek Personality Test – Results Myers-Briggs would say that you are an INTJ (Introvert, Intuitive, Thinker, Judger). In Star Trek language, you share a basic personality configuration with Jean-Luc Picard and Seven of Nine. People like you are generally autonomous, aloof, and intellectual. You sometimes give the impression you have no need of others, but you’re intensely curious and driven to learn. You’re cautious with others socially and respond best to people who don’t push you to be friendly or affectionate. You appreciate when others follow your lead and accept your criticism in the helpful spirit in which it is intended. You’re calm by nature and feel off-balance when confronted by highly emotional people. You’re highly organized and expect the same of others. You analyze automatically and enjoy seeing patterns and trends. When your mind is made up, that’s it, which means that while you’re definitive and strong, you can be stubborn and arrogant. You respond best to other people’s needs when they tell you about them clearly. You value honesty greatly. You prize people who listen to you and respect your ideals. You are somewhat contemptuous of those who don’t pay attention to what you say. You’re a conservative dresser, but you have a unique and personal style. Your primary goal in life is achieving independence and being able to live according to your own standards. Your reward is continual expansion of your competence and knowledge. Good careers for your type include being a starship captain, intellectual property attorney, news analyst, design engineer, software developer, inventor, Webmaster, architect, and ex-Borg. Let me know if you think, for those of you who know me, the test was accurate!
items.content_text:
I just found this Star Trek personality test and it was pretty close. Below are my results:

Star Trek Personality Test -- Results
Myers-Briggs would say that you are an INTJ (Introvert, Intuitive, Thinker, Judger). In Star Trek language, you share a basic personality configuration with Jean-Luc Picard and Seven of Nine.
People like you are generally autonomous, aloof, and intellectual. You sometimes give the impression you have no need of others, but you're intensely curious and driven to learn. You're cautious with others socially and respond best to people who don't push you to be friendly or affectionate. You appreciate when others follow your lead and accept your criticism in the helpful spirit in which it is intended. You're calm by nature and feel off-balance when confronted by highly emotional people.
You're highly organized and expect the same of others. You analyze automatically and enjoy seeing patterns and trends. When your mind is made up, that's it, which means that while you're definitive and strong, you can be stubborn and arrogant.
You respond best to other people's needs when they tell you about them clearly. You value honesty greatly. You prize people who listen to you and respect your ideals. You are somewhat contemptuous of those who don't pay attention to what you say.
You're a conservative dresser, but you have a unique and personal style.
Your primary goal in life is achieving independence and being able to live according to your own standards. Your reward is continual expansion of your competence and knowledge.
Good careers for your type include being a starship captain, intellectual property attorney, news analyst, design engineer, software developer, inventor, Webmaster, architect, and ex-Borg.

Let me know if you think, for those of you who know me, the test was accurate!

items.content_html: I thought that I would never see this again. Once in my lifetime was enough and it has happened again. I was a junior in High School back in January 28, 1986 in class when I was told about the Space Shuttle Challenger blew up during take off. Now 17 years later Space Shuttle Columbia blew up on re-entry. You can find more information from this link at MSNBC.com or this one at ABCNews.com. I have found the best coverage on ABCNews.com using my RealPlayer paid account. I am very sad. This is a shining program for our Country and I would like to go to Space some day. I always believed it put you as physically close to the Lord and Saviour as possible. I will keep the families of these brave Astronauts in my prayers.
items.content_text: I thought that I would never see this again. Once in my lifetime was enough and it has happened again. I was a junior in High School back in January 28, 1986 in class when I was told about the Space Shuttle Challenger blew up during take off. Now 17 years later Space Shuttle Columbia blew up on re-entry. You can find more information from this link at MSNBC.com or this one at ABCNews.com. I have found the best coverage on ABCNews.com using my RealPlayer paid account. I am very sad. This is a shining program for our Country and I would like to go to Space some day. I always believed it put you as physically close to the Lord and Saviour as possible. I will keep the families of these brave Astronauts in my prayers.

items.content_html: I go back to work tomorrow. It is the start of the pay week. I will be off on Saturday and Sunday. Henry is doing much better he has another follow-up on Wednesday at 3:15 PM. I have a doctors appointment on Monday at 3 PM. Well, I hope tomorrow goes good for me. I am going to bed early tonight. Also, the 8th of this month started my 13th year at my current job. 12 more to go even if I get this new job my retirement time will transfer with me. Going from a State to County job more money and better benefits. I hope to know something within the next month.

Next appointment next Wednesday at 2:15 PM. I am also broker then broke. I need my tax return which is supposed to be deposited on the 25th of February.

items.content_html: Henry is doing better. He is trying to scratch at his left eye. But, he has a protective collar on. He is eating and drinking and appears to be in less pain. He is also keeping the eye open and it looks good. Hope the Vet thinks so on Tuesday. Three weeks and the stitches come out of his eye. I will be glad when I can discontinue giving him his eye medicine. I have to get up at 2 AM every morning then again at 8 AM to give it to him. I watched an excellent movie last night, The Bourne Identity. Very good. Matt Damon really does a good job with the part. I hope there is a sequel. I might get a pay per view movie tonight not sure. I hate football and there is nothing on because of the Super Bowl.

items.content_html: Henry is home right now. He does not look bad. He has stitches in his left eye and eye lid. He is still very sleepy. I will put his medication in his eye later. He was very happy to see me. He was wagging his tail while trying to close his eyes. He has a follow-up appointment tomorrow at 11:15 AM. Total bill for the left eye only $1355 and $101 for medicine at Walgreens.

items.content_html: I took Henry to the Vet Ophthalmologist yesterday. The bad news is he definitely has a cataract in the left eye. The worse news is he has a small developing one in the right eye. The even worse news is that it will cost $1800 to have both eyes done. So, I will be doing that in February. Off until Monday, kind of. I have to work overtime on Saturday but the money is needed with Henry’s problem.

items.content_html: I received some very very bad news today. I had to take Henry to the Vet today for his annual. I was supposed to take him on Wednesday the 8th but noticed something wrong with his left eye Friday. He had a gray tint to his left eye. So, I called the Vet and had to take him in this morning. He has a cataract in the left eye. He has an appointment with a Vet who specializes in ophthalmology on Wednesday. This visit is going to cost $95.00 dollars and the surgery if he has to have is very expensive could be as high as $2000.00. I don’t know where I am going to get that kind of money. But, I can not let my dog go blind either.

I am hoping to change jobs or at last change locations in my current job. I am hoping to get more bills paid off and lose more weight. Thinking of going on the 14 day strict diet again in the middle of the next month. Well, to everyone I will see you in the New Year. I am not much for celebrating New Year’s Eve so I am spending it at home. Not working tonight.

items.content_html: Today is Christmas Eve! Merry Christmas to everyone. I do not have to work today. I have Christmas Eve off and do not have to go to work until 10 PM tomorrow. I will tell you that I will be glad this year will be over in a few days. This has not been an amazing year for me. However, I do think next year will be one for me. I am hoping to start a new employer next year. Same kind of job. But, new employer hopefully. Or if at my present employer maybe at least a new location. Well, I think there will be a lot of new stuff for me next year. On the debt front I should have at least 4 major bills paid off next year. Still on track to getting all bills paid off in 2 years.

items.content_html: I off, off, off until Saturday. I wanted to take this time and tell everyone I wish that they have a great Thanksgiving! I have finally had it with my ReplayTV. The thing works and works great. However, it hates my cable connection. It did not record my shows tonight Everwood, 7th Heaven and CSI Miami. Luckily, I only missed 15 minutes of CSI Miami. I can catch Everwood on Sunday (I have to record it because I will be working) but 7th Heaven is a wash. This makes me enraged. So, I have put it up on Ebay. Like I said the unit works it just does not like my Cable company and connection for some reason. I hope to sale it. But, in any event I am going to go in the hole in the short term and buy another TIVO.

items.content_html: Voted today and did other errands. I will be working overtime on Wednesday and Thursday. Friday will be a long day as well. On the financial front I am doing miserable. Hence, all the overtime. This will be a bleak Christmas for me. I have already informed my family. I told them not to expect much from me and I don’t expect or want anything this year. I will barely be able to afford my company Christmas party and buy my niece a toy or too. I will have to charge both of those as well. But, in the long run I should be ok. I am still on target to be 95% debt free by the end of 2004 and hopefully have my own house by April 2005. Why is it I can’t have a 1 million dollar day. I would actually just settle for $40000.00 to pay off my bills.

items.content_html: Yesterday went for my physical. Doctor gave me a very thorough examination. He said everything on physical inspection looked good. My blood pressure was 116/86. They took 3 vails of blood and urine. They only call if something is wrong. But, I will probably call them to see how the results were. I liked this Doctor. I got a flu shot and a tetanus shot. Back to the grind tomorrow. Not looking forward to it. Still hoping to win the lottery. Just enough to pay my bills off. Why can’t I win?

items.content_html: Why do I have to be so mistreated? I was called back to work unfairly on my day off and suppose extended weekend. Why you ask?, For what I call over reaction to a situation that could have been easily explained to everyone (blowing up a minor fire into a raging inferno). Well, I am totally hoping I find and get a new job by the end of the year. I can’t take this one anymore. I am just like a robot. I go to work only out of necessity (pay bills).

items.content_html: Well, I got the SonicBlue ReplayTV yesterday. So far I have to say TIVO is better. TIVO implements it’s system in a more user friendly way. SonicBlue is not a bad company. The ReplayTV does have 3 things I really like. Such as, Ethernet connection to update instead of telephone line, automatically skips commercial when viewing recorded material and can program to record a show from the Internet so don’t have to be home. But, if I had to recommend a PVR/DVR to someone I have to say I like the TIVO better.

items.content_html: Hello everyone, First of all I have made some bad financial choices in the past couple of weeks. I purchased a real web site (or at least I thought) from Web Extreme it costs me $157.00 dollars and after the first year it would have been $132.00. I had a minor problem at first and this was miss communication. Then I developed a big problem. I could receive e-mail but not send via my e-mail program. I tried to contact technical support and no support. They are supposed to have a 30 day money back guarantee less the $25.00 setup fee. Well, I choose to cancel. I have been trying to get my money back and have the account cancel for a week. I even found a telephone number for the supposed administrator. Well still no luck it seems I am out my money. Lesson learned. I have transfer back my Michael@michaelleemitchell.net e-mail address back to Yahoo!. Hopefulley it will be available again in about 4 days. That cost me an additional $10.00. Lesson learned if I do get a real full pledge web site it will be with a big company such as Verizon or Bellsouth. Even if it costs more. Why can’t people just stick to their word? I do!

items.content_html: Well, unfortunately I start midnights tonight. For the next 28 days my life will come to a busy zombie movie. Work, sleep, eat, doing employment things for a new perspective job and more work. But, I have a good concept that I wish I could market. A PC that is running some operating system (Linux, Windows XP Professional, etc…) with multiple processors. This would be the house server. Every house would have one. Every thing in the house would have a Ethernet connection. The house server would store all your DVD’s and CD’s. Your TV Signal would pass through it. Your Internet connection would be tied into it. Your PC could pass on that episode of The Shield or Smallville that it recorded as the DVR to any TV you are watching in any room. While your refrigerator is telling the house server that the ice machine is filling up and someone requests a CD be played in the bathroom while they take a shower. That is the next thing. Of course you would have to have another computer that is hooked up to the house server so that you play games. The house server would also be the answering machine, fax machine and etc…… What do you think? Anyone want to give my capital?

items.content_html: Well, money, money and more money. That is what I need. I just read on the MSNBC site that a job satisfaction survey show more than half of people are disgruntled with there jobs and there co-workers among other things. Well, I am disgruntled with my job not necessarily because of my co-workers but for promotions policies, money, schedule and educational training. I need more money. Like Jerry Maguire said show me the money.

I am thinking about adding a calendar. Let me know what you think. Also, I need to catch up on my TV watching. I also need some sleep so I will be back tomorrow. Unless….. Rapture.

items.content_html: Well, feeling much better. Just need my voice to get back to normal. As of today I have 16 days until my vacation. I keep hoping I will win the lottery so that I don’t have to go back.

items.content_html: Just to let everyone now. The antibiotics have kicked in. So have the steroids the doctor put me on. I feel about 50% better. I hope to be up to a 100% by Thursday. I am starting to get my voice back. It is still rather raspy though.

items.content_html: It is official I have bronchitis. I went to the doctor today. I am on three medications. An antibiotic, a steroid and a decongestant. I feel miserable. You know when you say someone looks miserable. You do not know what miserable is until you have had this. I don’t know if I will be adding any entries the next day or two. I am not quite myself.

items.content_html: Yesterday and today make me think I am going to die. I have a chest cold and it has brought be to staying in bed. One minute I am hot with sweat pouring off of me the next freezing cold. This is the second cold I have had this year. I haven’t had this many for a long time. What a way to spend a vacation….

items.content_html: Another weekend is here. I look forward to it for the time off. However, TV stinks on the weekend. In fact, it stinks from Thursday nights till Monday nights. My viewing is featured pack on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. I start of with 7th Heaven on Monday followed by Third Watch. On Tuesday it is Smallville and Gilmore Girls. Wednesday’s it is Enterprise and then Dawson’s Creek. Though I have to admit I am getting tired of Dawson’s Creek. That is for the week. Besides me watching Call for Help and The Screen Savers on TechTV. In between it is CNBC. I wished they were to make a couple of Star Trek’s. It was great having Star Trek Voyager then Deep Space Nine. Why are the making TV so boring lately? Especially on the weekends. There are no more good shows, other than the aforementioned ones. I find myself buying more and more DVD’s. I put a file on the Favorite Links page. It is a true type font of my very own handwriting (print not cursive).

items.content_html: Today was a good day a work. However, when I got home it was not good. It started out good but turned horrible. I had to take my Mom and Dad’s dog Camelot to the pound. He had cancer. He was starting to suffer. He was not eating, drinking or using the bathroom. I had to take him so they could euthanized him today. That was very hard to do. I rarely cry but I did today. He was a good dog. He never fussed about anything. Henry my dog is like a child to me. I feel for Henry the same way I feel for my niece Alexus. I felt like Camelot was one of family. Dogs can make people cry and laugh. Most people just think of them as animals. But, for some, like me, they are kid replacements.

items.content_html: Well, I am finally off midnights. Yesterday at 6AM was my last day. I stay awake all day and got some sleep last night. I believe I should be back to normal by Friday. Today is errand day. I took Henry (my dog) to the groomers yesterday. I am taking him to the Vet today to get his teeth clean. Then I go get the truck an oil change, Sears for a new watch battery, Pearle Vision to have be glasses fixed and finally Walgreens to get some stuff and back home until Henry is ready to be picked up. I did my father and mother’s, brothers and sisters taxes yesterday. The all electronically file. I usually do. But, this year I filed only 1040EZ so I did the teletax thing. Went smooth. I got my refund back in a week. Well later on today I will be turning on the Webcam to update my website Webcam page. Take care to all and to Krystal and all other co-workers see you on Monday morning bright and early.

items.content_html: Well, I have a wireless network up and running. My new computer which I just got a little over a month ago started to have a lot crashes. I found out it was from Microsoft Agent Software. This piece of Software is not compatible with Windows XP. I had to wipe my whole hard drive and reinstall the operating system. Everything has gone fine. I am back to about 85% of where I was. It will probably take me another month or two to see have everything installed. I am also weeding out what is and what is not compatible with Windows XP. In bad news today, I helped my mom take there dog, Camelot to the Vet. He has not been feeling well. He is a 120 pound Rottweiler. He has cancer and it is maligant. They cannot do anything for him. They had to put him to sleep just to examine him. We will pick him up tomorrow. He has about 3 to 6 months.

items.content_html: Well, I kept getting called by Eckerd Corportation Today. It was a fax machine. It called me for over an hour. I would answer and it would be that stupid fax. So using my caller ID I called the number and got some very rude lady. I explained what was happening and she said what do you want me to do there must be over a 1000 people working here. I said I want it to stop this is getting ridculious. I said someone has the wrong number punched in. She kept giving me a hard time. I told her let me speak to a supervisor. I got a more cooperative person and she apologized and said she would see what see could do. As soon as I hung up with her it happened again. It did it one more time and then it stopped.

I got heat exhaustation. However, a nice man and his wife saw my situation and stopped to help. All got fix and I made it home. I have already written a thank you letter to the man and his wife. Now for a whole day off.

Well, tomorrow is my last day of work until Tuesday. I was planning to work my overtime Tuesday but will do it on Wednesday instead.
